There still are some questionalble grammatical things in there but I guess that they are due to the original author and not because they are quoted wrong.

I hope I got them at least mostly and that this causes, for once, no further problems.

Sagittarius

title: REMOVE: Redundant comment in CSS
body:
The comment indicated the same CSS which was written below


### Description
Removed 2 CSS comments which had the same style written below.

Like this -  
```diff
- / * property_x: value_y; */
property_x: value_y;
```

It ain't much but it's honest work 🙂

title: add ukrainian quotes
body:
## Description
### Translations aren't 100% accurate and some are definitely grammatically incorrect, but they represent core meaning though.
1. There is no science without books, no enlightenment without science, and without enlightenment - all misery. - Ivan Franko
2. Life without freedom, without the right to self-determination - is the life of a soul on a hook. - Lesya Ukrainka
3. A person's work determines their value. - Taras Shevchenko
4. One should live for the state and die for it. - Bohdan Khmelnytsky
5. One for all, and all for one. - Petro Sagaidachny
6. Courage makes victory possible. - Andriy Meleshko
7. A person lives as long as the memory of them lives in the hearts of others. - Vasyl Sukhomlynsky
8. Success always begins with a dream. - Olena Pchilka
9. Not only great deeds, but also small actions can change the world. - Hryhoriy Skovoroda
10. Education is the light that illuminates the dark paths of our lives. - Mykhailo Hrushevsky
11. Strength lies not in the sword, but in the spirit that holds the sword. - Yaroslav the Wise
12. Nothing happens twice, and everything that happens - forever. - Yuri Andrukhovych
13. True love is a moment of inspiration that can last an eternity. - Oleksandr Dovzhenko
14. With love for our people, we must raise our children. - Lina Kostenko
15. A person who does not take risks will never achieve success. - Volodymyr Vynnychenko
16. The ability to forgive is a great strength of the spirit. - Marko Vovchok
17. You will take with you only what you have shared with others. - Ostap Vyshnia
18. Freedom is when you understand that the responsibility for your life belongs to you. - Pavlo Tychyna
19. Laughter is the best medicine for the soul. - Yevhen Hutsalo
20. Happiness is the ability to rejoice in small things. - Valerian Pidmohylny
21. It is the heart that leads us to true happiness, not the mind. - Ivan Bahrianyi
22. Good deeds should be reflected in the heart, notin the wallet. - Mykola Gogol
23. Life is too short not to do what you love. - Oleksandr Ivanovych Kuprin
24. Words have great power, but only the heart can understand them. - Vasyl Stus
25. Real success lies in overcoming your fears. - Andriy Kuzmenko
26. Creativity is a journey into the unknown, where you can find inspiration. - Oleg Lysheha
27. Every moment is a priceless gift that we should cherish. - Oksana Zabuzhko
28. Happiness is when your desires coincide with your abilities. - Anatoliy Dimarov
29. Love for one's homeland is a source of inspiration and strength. - Iryna Wilde
30. Courage is the ability to stand shoulder to shoulder with your fears. - Volodymyr Vernadsky

title: Update `dynamic` Keymap Legend Style to More Accurately Reflect Casing
body:
### Description

This PR ensures that the keymap legend displays the correct casing of every key for every combination of CapsLock, Shift, and user platform. It also improves performance by eliminating code that runs for no reason.

Previously, when using the `dynamic` keymap legend style, pressing CapsLock would use the "capitalized" version of every key, and pressing Shift would do the same, but it would also effectively "invert" the state of CapsLock.

What I mean by that is that if you press CapsLock, every key "capitalizes," but then if you also hold Shift, it will go back to lowercase. As it turns out, Shift inverting the state of CapsLock does not happen on MacOS. So I provided an edge case to rule out MacOS from that behavior.

CapsLock also only capitalizes letters, not symbols, but Shift does both. So I have two different states managing the capitalization of letters and symbols.

Finally, if the user is using `oppositeShiftMode`, then the keymap will only capitalize what they can press. This includes a complete overhaul of `isUsingOppositeShift`.

Screenshots (click me)

 ![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79121360/225852885-57031bc4-9962-4ef1-a67f-3be2ce89f9d4.png) ![showcase of kanagawa in the monkeytype command line](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79121360/225852352-2454d9a9-7038-4c16-bca3-b8bdd8b86c54.png) #### With Colorful Mode ![kanagawa theme with colorful mode enabled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79121360/225852095-2308cf3c-d1cc-4e34-86a5-b43a543117e5.png) #### With Test Colors Flipped ![kanagawa theme with test colors flipped enabled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79121360/225853512-e90ad63c-db1b-4812-bfb0-7f42e5dc1c75.png) #### With Colorful Mode and Test Colors Flipped ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79121360/225853329-d07674a1-cd4c-4c54-b8b8-ba4797480255.png)
### Note I am a little bit concerned about the contrast between the different error colors. Please provide some feedback on the color choice. These colors were taken from the [kanagawa.nvim](https://github.com/rebelot/kanagawa.nvim) [color palette](https://github.com/rebelot/kanagawa.nvim#color-palette). title: Added new German quotes
body:
Hey Mio, I readded the changes I discarded and added 3 additional quotes. This time in an updated fork. Since you probably already saw the translations of the other quotes, I will only translate the new ones. 
- "Does Olaf Scholz like to eat kebabs? Sure he does. I've been enjoying them for a long time and I like eating kebabs." Olaf Scholz in an Instagram Reel, 2023
- "Mr Scholz, when will Bubatz [Cannabis] be legal? - We have decided that we want to legalise cannabis, and that will be implemented. Preparations are now underway, it will happen in this legislative period, but we have not yet set the exact date." Olaf Scholz in an interview in 2022 about the cannabis legalization in Germany. Also, this quote includes the question and his answer, so I gave the interviewer and Scholz as the source.
- "Germany is a strong country, and the motive in which we approach these things must be: "We have achieved so much, we can do it." Merkel in a speech about the refugee crisis, 2015

title: Added a few new German quotes
body:
Translations: 
- "We make our way through the throng of people along the familiar path. Along the alleys to the Rhine terraces, over the bridges, to the music. Where everything is loud, where everyone is on it to go crazy. Where the others are waiting to start and leave with us." from the song 'Tage wie diese' by the German rock band 'Die Toten Hosen'
- "The internet is new territory for all of us, and it naturally also enables enemies and opponents of our basic democratic order to use new means and new approaches to put our way of life in danger. That's why we also have to talk about what rules apply, how things have to be restricted, where there also have to be exceptions, where there has to be transparency." Famous quote from a speech by Angela Merkel from 2013 regarding internet privacy
- "Get out of bed, turn up the swag. Take a quick look in the mirror, say \"What up?\"" by Money Boy, cited from the song 'Dreh den Swag auf'. Iconic Song in pop culture by a famous Austrian rapper.
- "There is an idea of Patrick Bateman, a kind of abstraction. But there is no real me, only an illusion, something deceptive. And though I can hide my cold gaze and you shake my hand and feel flesh enclosing yours and maybe you even feel that our lifestyles are probably comparable.... I am simply not there." from the German version of 'American Psycho'
- "Look at this little card. It means that much. The front is plain white, subtle, the company logo in silver. The back contains all the important information: Name, address, phone numbers, email address. The font is a little bold, but not intrusive. A hint of vanilla." Also from 'American Psycho'.
- "You know, once we get back home, we're gonna do something big. The two of us. The two of us together, yeah?" from the new movie 'Im Westen nichts Neues' (All quiet on the western front)
- "What should we do? Nail up shoe soles together? Are you trying to insult me? I can't even read a letter from my wife. You go study, Paul. Or I'll shoot you right here. My pants are slipping." All quiet on the western front
- "I stand before you in the hope that you will take our presence as an opportunity to suspend all hostilities. In the name of humanity, I ask you to agree to an immediate ceasefire for the duration of the negotiations in order to spare our peoples unnecessary victims. Matthias Erzberger, Head of the German Delegation." All quiet on the western front

title: feat: support Emacs/Vim navigation in command line
body:
### Description

Adds support for moving the selection up and down in the command line with ctrl-n/p (emacs) and ctrl-j/k (vim), which is muscle memory for a lot of people but currently unsupported in the main list view people use.

Supporting both feels a lot more natural, and makes navigation easier for people that either don't have arrow keys at all or on their main layer (like myself!)

title: Changed event on hiding popups to be mousedown
body:
### Description

This changes the event on some popups to be hidden on mousedown instead of click. This is mostly noticeable in cases where a popup is closed due to selecting text and dragging the cursor off the popup and releasing. This update will prevent that and only allow popups to be closed on a mousedown event. This has been tested with mobile and still allows tapping off a popup to close.

Closes #

N/A

title: improve password length check
body:
### Description

Integrate check for too long passwords into `isPasswordStrong`, and consistently check for it wherever passwords can be created / changed.

As discussed on discord with @Miodec. There was 1 check in place for 25 characters, which could easily be avoided when resetting your password, or changing it in settings.

The max length of 64 is a sure-to-be-safe length that still allows for much safer passwords, but longer lengths should still work fine with firebase.

The login page now also checks for `isLocalhost` to ingore password checks as requested by @Miodec.

There is still some duplication of the password checks where importing the function is not possible, or more info than the boolean result is needed.

title: Fixed issue #3971 - active theme selection is properly removed
body:
I left a bug report, issue #3971, which showed how the active theme selection in the theme section of the settings wasn't being properly removed when the user changed the settings. We would have something that looked like this. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46613983/216743906-44de2825-9aa3-459e-8613-ea7fcd6150e4.png)

This PR fixes that.

title: New Sound on Click - Pentatonic Scale
body:
See the following videos for a demo of what this new pentatonic scale sounds like within Monkeytype:

Regular Words: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UgmVM3OYaAI
Zen Mode: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=USeoRQtMkq4

### Description
This PR adds a new sound-on-click to MonkeyType, using a procedurally generated pentatonic scale to create this dream-like fairy sound whenever the user types a letter. It adds to the existing codebase, continuing to leverage the Web Audio API  to allow for a new type - musical scales (major, minor, pentatonic, blues etc). 

In a nutshell, the pentatonic scale is a set of notes that sounds pleasant regardless of rhythm or order because of how it's arranged - free of any semitone differences between every note, which the human ear perceives as "bad sounding". The code within this PR is the C pentatonic scale, shown below. For context, I learned about this because of some quirky high school jazz band theory. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46613983/216741320-b3a3d26c-47ff-46f9-91f5-38df10f2a097.png)

If interested, check out this [link](https://www.percussionplay.com/five-notes-to-rule-them-all/#:~:text=Why%20does%20the%20Pentatonic%20Scale,the%20notes%20in%20the%20scale.) for more information about why the pentatonic scale sounds nice. 

It's especially interesting because the words per minute directly correspond to the rhythm of the sound, which gives the user full control over the rhythm of the music. Best way to preview this is to `git clone` this branch, and experience it for yourself.

title: Structure
body:
This PR adds many optimisations aimed to reduce the number of elements in the DOM at all times by removing unused pages and popups from the DOM instead of hiding them. This should result in quicker HTML and CSS recalculations when the DOM changes.

Page change has been optimised by identifying long tasks and splitting them up. This ensures animation frames will always fire, making the page appear more responsive (even if actual page change speeds may have not changed that much)

(PR may contain random fixes here and there - most of them were cherry picked onto master)

Also closes #3861

title: Fix french punctuation typo - missing space
body:
### Description

In french, there is always a space character before ! ? or : punctuation signs. 
This PR fixes the few quotes missing this space character.

{

{
      "text" : " Light takes millions of years to reach our eyes from distant stars . Therefore , when we look into space , we are looking into the past . The best telescopes allow us to see light that began its journey to us about 10 billion years ago. therefore ." ,

And , therefore , a neutron star is born ." ,

      "id" : 70
},
{
      "text" : " Black holes are regions in space where gravity is so powerful that even light cannot resist their relentless pull . Astronomers believe that at the center of our galaxy , the Milky Way , there may be a giant black hole with a mass greater than than a million suns ." ,

      "id" : 71
},
{
      "text" : " Light consists of parts called photons . Photons are special particles : scientists say that photons have no mass at all at rest . But photons do not stand still . In fact , photons are carried around the universe at a limited cosmic speed - 300,000 kilometers per second ." ,

      "length" : 283,
      "id" : 72
},
{
      "text" : " From the beginning , life relied on sunlight like a car needs gasoline .       "length" : 359,
      "id" : 73

{

The light produced is equal to the amount of light from 4 trillion trillion light bulbs ." ,

      "length" : 417,
      "id" : 74
},
{
      "text" : " The most massive stars can eventually collapse into black holes . In a black hole, the gravity is so strong that even light cannot escape . {
      "text" : " Everyone has his own destiny and his own wide path : he builds , he destroys , he looks with a keen eye over the edge of the world to see if there is a country to conquer and take with him as a home . And that one , quiet and sober , God-fearing , like a cat sneaking up , will see an unhappy time in your life and will launch its claws into your liver , - and do n't beg : neither the children nor the woman will beg . And that one , generous and luxurious , he builds all the temples ; the fatherland loves him so much , mourns for him so much, blood flows like water from his heart !... And the brothers are silent to themselves , staring out their eyes ! Like lambs : " Let it be ," he says , - Maybe , that's the way it should be \ ". That's the way it should be ! Because there is no Lord in the sky ! And you fall under the yoke and beg for some kind of Paradise in that world ? There is none ! There is none !" ,

      "id" : 76
},
{
      "text" : " We are flying . I look until it dawns , the edge of the sky is on fire , the sun meets the nightingale in a dark grove . The gardens are abundant , the poplars are standing on their own , as if the watchman , they talk to the field . And all the same , the whole country , enveloped in beauty , turns green , washed with fine dew , washed from time immemorial , the sun meets ... And there is no beginning to it, and there is no end ! No one will finish it and destroy it .. . And that 's all ... My soul , what are you sad about ? My poor soul , why are you crying in vain , why are you sorry ? Don't you see , don't you hear human crying ?" ,
      "source" : " Taras Shevchenko — Dream " ,
      "length" : 584,
      "id" : 77
},
{
      "text" : " When I die , bury me in a grave in the middle of the vast steppe in the Ukraine , so that the meadows of the wide fields , and the Dnieper , and the cliffs could be seen , and the roaring roar could be heard . I will go away from the deer and the mountains - I will leave everything , and I will turn to God himself to pray ... and besides, I do not know God . Bury and get up , tear the shackles and sprinkle the enemy with the evil blood of the will . And I am in a big family , in a free family , new , don't forget to mention it with a kind, quiet word ." ,
      "source" : " Taras Shevchenko — Testament " ,
      "length" : 468,
      "id" : 78
},
{
      "text" : " Good evening everyone ! The leader of the faction is here . The head of the president 's office is here . Prime minister Shmyhal is here . Podolyak is here . The president is here . We are all here . Our military is here . Citizens , society is here We are all here . We are defending our independence , our state , and it will continue to be so . Glory to our defenders , glory to our defenders . Glory to Ukraine ! " ,
      "source" : " Volodymyr Zelenskyi " ,
      "length" : 336,
      "id" : 79
},
{
      "text" : " Dear citizens of Ukraine ! This morning, President Putin announced the introduction of a special military operation in the Donbass . Russia attacked our military infrastructure and our border guards , border units . Explosions were heard in many cities of Ukraine . We are introducing martial law in throughout the territory of our state . A minute ago I had a conversation with President Biden . The United States of America has already begun to mobilize international support . Today, calm is needed from you , from each of you . If you can , please stay at home . We are working . The army is working . It is working the entire security and defense sector of Ukraine . I , the NSDC , the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine will always be in touch with you . I will be in touch again soon . Do not panic . We are strong , we are ready for anything , we will defeat everyone , because we are Ukraine . Glory to Ukraine !" ,
      "source" : " Volodymyr Zelenskyi " ,
      "length" : 824,
      "id" : 80
},
{
      "text" : " The fact that the territory of Ukraine began to be populated from the Carpathians , even when the dawn of the Early Paleolithic was just rising over Europe , is evidenced by the oldest in Central and Eastern Europe, the Royal Paleolithic site , located in sunny Transcarpathia . This site was discovered in 1974 by a Kyiv archaeologist Vladyslav Gladylin , studied it for many years , thus inscribing his name in science in capital letters .
      "source" : " History of Ukraine from grandfather Svyrid " ,
      "length" : 387,
      "id" : 81
},
{
      "text" : " The essence of the Neolithic revolution was that , in order for people to feed themselves , it was not enough for them to just engage in appropriative management ( hunting , fishing , gathering ). They had to roll up their sleeves and switch to a reproductive type of management ( farming , cattle breeding )." ,
      "source" : " History of Ukraine from grandfather Svyrid " ,
      "length" : 271,
      "id" : 82
},
{
      "text" : " Were the people of Trypil our ancestors ? I answer : both yes and no . Anthropologists claim that the people of Trypil were stocky and dark in appearance , and in terms of the shape of their skulls they resembled the modern inhabitants of the south of Europe - Italians or Corsicans . Genetic analysis also does not confirm the close kinship of modern Ukrainians with the population of Tripoli . So why then \" yes \ "? Because the people of Tripoli are mentally like relatives to us . A sincere Tripoli citizen would love to have a farm , livestock , a piglet , a cherry orchard , and to have there were ears of corn in the field ." ,
      "source" : " History of Ukraine from grandfather Svyrid " ,
      "length" : 533,
      "id" : 83
},
{
      "text" : "The universe is like a dark forest , where every civilization is a hunter armed to the teeth . It stealthily , like a ghost , sneaks through the thickets of the forest , rejecting the branches that come across the way . It carefully plans each next step so as not to reveal its presence with the crunch of a sushnyatka under his feet ; he even breathes once in a while . He must be careful , because the forest is full of other hunters , who likewise sneak very close . And if he finds any other form of life - another hunter , angel or devil , rosy- cheeked a baby or a decrepit old man , a fairy or a demigod - he has only one thing left : to be the first to open fire ." ,
      "source" : " Liu Qixin — Dark Forest " ,
      "length" : 614,
      "id" : 84
},

title: Add audio fade to remove audible 'pop' within sine's sound-on-click
body:
When the volume of the sound-on-click is set to loud, the 'sine' sound generated through the `oscillatorNode` has an audible 'pop' sound that can be quite distracting. This is most apparent when you go to zen mode and do some keyboard mashing.

The reason there is this pop is that the audio abruptly stops within the function call `oscillatorNode.stop(audioCtx.currentTime + 1);` on line 377 of `sound-controller.ts` without any fading in the volume. 

This problem is outlined in this [StackOverflow post.
](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29378875/how-can-i-avoid-this-clicking-sound-when-i-stop-playing-a-sound)

This can be solved by implementing an audio fade using the gainNode's function setTargetAtTime(), which [the MDN web docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioParam/setTargetAtTime) states is a function that exponentially curves the volume downwards to your desired volume. In this case, we would want to see it to curve downwards until a volume of zero, creating a natural audio fade.   

It also makes the sounds more organic, by tapering the volume as you would find in instruments like a piano note.

title: Fix letter i in ukrajins'ka latynka
body: ### Description Closes #3889 I simply ran a script for swapping letters: ```python import os import glob filenames = glob.glob('*latynka*') print(filenames) for filename in filenames: with open(filename, 'r', encoding='utf8') as file: contents = file.read() contents = contents.replace(chr(1110), chr(105)) with open(filename, 'w', encoding='utf8') as file: file.write(contents) print("Done!") ``` And make sure that now files have the intended letter via copy pasting letter into terminal like: ### Other notes - Yes this is very simple and maybe there was no need for opening an issue but I wanted to try that. Anyway would you open an issue if you were having same problem, or would you simply make a pr?

title: Add support for Swiss Keyboard layout in ch-de and ch-fr varieties
body:
### Description
Added support for the Swiss Keyboard in CH-DE and CH-FR flavors.

Since the proper diaeresis symbol `¨` that's associated with one of the keys causes issues with the uppercase switch since it's a combining character and swallows up the `!` I replaced it with a two dot leader `‥` which still conveys the visual message of it being an accent but doesn't have to be combined with a space for correctness.

title: Create english_gratitude_100.json
body:
### Description

Adds a new type of language for use in priming a particular domain of words in its users minds. This language contains 100 words useful in expressing gratitude. It may help users embody feelings of gratitude as they type. This could be useful to intentionally shift one's mindset or to prepare to express gratitude. 

Future work includes expanding this language, adding other useful domains (for example to help express other emotions), and building its member words scientifically (I generated this first batch by pulling example sentences for expressing gratitude from the internet, but it could be generated algorithmically from any number of etymological or psychological references).

title: Mapped letter k to make a sound in sound controller
body:
For some reason, the 'K' key isn't mapped to produce any sound within the sound-controller. I'm not sure if this is some sort of deliberate persecution against the letter k, but in case it is unintentional, here we go!

I mapped it according to the chromatic pattern within `codeToNote`, and choose A flat as the note since it is the least frequent to even out the distribution of sounds from the keys.

title: Adding customStyle property to 'Command' object interface
body: This is the implementation of the [discussion post](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/discussions/3864) feature I submitted. Currently, some of the dropdown options within the Command Line Interface could benefit greatly from visual styling - especially the `Theme...` and `Font Family....` dropdown options. By implementing an optional `customStyle` property of type `string` to the `Command` interface, we could easily style certain dropdown options by passing in CSS strings when we are pushing each `Command` object into it's respective `CommandsSubgroup`. Here are some examples I made with this new `customStyle` property: This might make the theme selection more intuitive. I will admit it is kind of an eyesore with certain theme combinations. Here, each font is rendered accordingly instead of having to cycle through each one to preview it. This property could further be used within the funbox command dropdown and such. It lays a framework for future customization within the command line interface. I'm unsure if this violates the minimalist philosophy behind the command line interface. I just found it easier to be able to visually preview some options instead of the classic drag-my-mouse-through-the-options-and-wait-one-second-to-preview, and wanted to give my two cents. 🤠

title: add `code-latex`
body:
### Description

Add `code-latex`.
The words chosen were provided by ChatGPT, but I've gone through them all, parsed them, and ensured all are valid latex commands.

It is worth noting that LaTeX is not code - so the `code-latex` name is not exactly accurate. I thought it was better to go in code than to create a new `typesetting` group.

I used the backslash example from [`code-haskell`](https://github.com/jameslounds/monkeytype-latex/blob/a606a6e321a6bd933d13f27501734e20d5de65e5/frontend/static/languages/code_haskell.json#L27)

title: Adding new Ukrajins'ka latynka language
body:
### Description

Ukraine is fighting and trying to improve on other directions as well. One of those improvements that is being discussed right now is moving from cyrillic alphabet to latin. If you have time and interest I recommend you to watch [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nHeE2x2UNw4), which has great details and explanations about why we are doing this.

More over many people already migrated to latin alphabet! A proof of that is [website](https://nachasi.com/ul/) fully in ukrains'ka latynka. I started using latin layout a couple days ago and sadly noticed that there is no training tool for it(

I think I'm not the only one who is searching for it, so your website will have a benefit after including it.

Thank's for ui and ux it's a joy to use! Hope to get a feedback and merge!

title: Add purpurite theme
body:
This pull request adds [purpurite](https://github.com/purpurite)'s [monkeytype theme](https://github.com/purpurite/monkeytype).

This pull request does not close any issues.

### License Information

purpurite is a "multi-app" colorscheme and is open source, it is licensed under UPL-1.0 (see license file here: [https://raw.ehan.dev/purpurite/purpurite/LICENSE.txt](https://raw.ehan.dev/purpurite/purpurite/LICENSE.txt))

purpurite has a separate repository with a copy of purpurite's monkeytype theme's css: [purpurite/monkeytype](https://github.com/purpurite/monkeytype). This repository does not contain any of monkeytype's original source code, it only contains this theme's css.

This separate repository is also licensed under UPL-1.0 (see license file for separate repository here: [https://raw.ehan.dev/purpurite/monkeytype/LICENSE.txt](https://raw.ehan.dev/purpurite/monkeytype/LICENSE.txt))

Since monkeytype is licensed under the GPL-3.0 license, and since the UPL-1.0 license gives the "`...rights to copy, create
derivative works of, display, perform, and distribute the Software...`", having two exact copies of the css file under different licenses *should* be no problem. However, if you believe it would be better to remove the separate repository please let me know. My only goal is to contribute my theme to this magnificent project and I do not care much about the "politics" of open source licenses. :sweat_smile: :sweat_smile:

### Screenshots

Screenshots are included in the separate repository's README, and some of them are included below for convenience. If you would like to see more screenshots, check the separate repository, linked above.


![Bildschirmfoto: purpurite - monkeytype](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98765025/209011855-d6763c8f-2f16-4f7f-9201-82ae345669ea.png)


![Bildschirmfoto: purpurite - monkeytype (Language-selector UI prompt)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98765025/209011959-c1678bf3-6cae-416f-aff8-fd67f4ca99a5.png)

![Bildschirmfoto: purpurite - monkeytype (Deutsch)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98765025/209012323-c296b006-3fde-4cd6-aa63-dbcda9f476ad.png)

### Thank you for considering this pull request

I hope my contribution is of use to this amazing project.

Please ping me with any questions, requested changes, or other concerns.

Thank you,
Ehan Ahamed (ehanahamed@ehan.dev)
21.12.2022

title: Ignore modifier keys for test autofocus
body:
### Description
Currently, when the user is focused on the restart button, any other key pressed will refocus the test. This poses problems for users who utilise remapping functions such as `ModTap` commonly utilised on sub 60% boards where `<hold> == Shift, <tap> == Enter`. This causes two keystrokes to be sent in quick succession such that a modtap user with the aforementioned mapping will never be able to use the `Tab+Enter` restart as `Shift` is always sent first.

This was resolved in https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/commit/9a0026a1ab6de87e7597d5216912a5849b1cbb2d in reponse to  https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/issues/1941, but was undone in https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/commit/76664fc7ae778a58bf803a8558dc71e2279d6941 as part of  https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/issues/2206 - as seemingly targeting the refresh button specifically caused unexpected behaviour.

Rather than dismiss keystrokes, I've elected to implement a small 200ms delay to refocus the test, other than for keys `Tab` and `Enter`, for which it will not take place. This gives time for `Enter` to be the prevailing key in the niche case above, and for the first returning key to resume normal operation.

Given every key will autofocus the test, the delay will never be present to affect typing as the the first keydown event will autofocus regardless after 200ms, or immediately if esc or tab, i.e. no delayed keystrokes appearing in typing test, no infinite debounce.

title: New Profane word list. Edited existing list for false negative prevention.
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

 -->

### Description

<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->
This PR contains an updated list of profane words.
    - We merged the list in the NPM package profane-words with the existing monkeytype list in order to preserve specific words.
    - We omitted some smaller words from both lists in order to decrease the amount of false positives.
    - We also manually edited the list to add some words we found that were not in the package list or the original.
    - 
Additionally, We merged the lists so that there were no duplicates in the overall list that is used for regexProfanities.

Closes #
Related issue:[ #3207](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/issues/3207)

title: Add data structures and algorithm quotes for C#
body:
### Description

As a programmer learning to type using Canary, I enjoyed revising my data structures and algorithms on [SpeedCoder.net](https://www.speedcoder.net/race/), and I believe that such quotes should be made available on monkeytype as well. The quantity of code quotes is quite lacking on monkeytype, and this is a useful and fun way to increase the quote count.

Added the following quotes:
1. Hello World
2. Factorial
3. Find the nth Fibonacci Number Recursively
4. Binary Search
5. Insertion Sort
6. Selection Sort
7. Bubble Sort
8. Merge Sort
9. Quick Sort
10. Quick Select

About correctness: I have ran the algorithms and they pass my sorting tests.

Note: the sorting algorithms are the same as those in Java, just that `arr.length` -> `arr.Length`, `System.out.println` -> `Console.Writeline` and all the method names have been capitalised.

### Progress
- [x] Add basic function quotes
- [x] Add sorting algorithm quotes
- [x] Add LinkedList quotes
- [x] Add Stack quotes
- [x] Add Queue quotes
- [x] Add Set quotes

title: fix Ukrainian quotes
body:
### Description
---
Just found out that Ukrainian (mostly Cyrillic) characters that look exactly the same as English (Latin) ones actually have different Unicode Encodings ( such as [Ukrainian (Cyrillic+) 'i'](https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0456/index.htm) and [Latin 'i'](https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0069/index.htm), [Cyrillic 'a'](https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0430/index.htm) and [Latin 'a'](https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0061/index.htm), etc ).
You live you learn, I guess :)

### Fixes:
1. Changed all latin chars to cyrillic;
2. Deleted a couple of invisible chars (oopsie);
3. Changed [" ' "](https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0027/index.htm) to [" ʼ "](https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2bc/index.htm) (Ukrainian keyboard layout uses slightly different apostrophe).

Wrote a script to check these kind of things, so won't happen in future PRs.

title: add Ukrainian quotes
body:
## Description
### Translations aren't 100% accurate and some are definitely grammatically incorrect, but they represent core meaning though.
---
<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->
#### Quotes by **[Ivan Franko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Franko)**:
1. Love does not depend on our will, comes without our merit, disappears without our fault.
2. What right do you have to be free when your people are in captivity? What right do you have to satisfy your whims and love desires when millions of your people have nothing to satisfy the most basic needs of life?
3. Law! It is understood, and we have heard something about the law, but we know all too well that the law is a theory that in a book, on paper, it looks very good, but in practice, living reality has its own special laws, far from being so smooth and rounded, but full of ramifications, spells and heterogeneities.
4. All that goes beyond the frame of the nation is either the [pharisaism](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/pharisaism) of people who, by international ideals, would be happy to cover up their contests for the domination of one nation over another, or the morbid sentimentalism of science fiction writers who would be happy to cover their spiritual alienation from their native nation with broad all-human phrases.
5. My patriotism is not sentiment, not national pride, but a heavy yoke.
 // yoke is a collar placed on the neck of a conquered person or prisoner to restrain movement
6. And we have either such a nature or such a long-standing custom, it is enough that whoever gets rich turns his face and heart away from the people from whom he came.
7. Life is my treasure, my own, lonely, of which the smallest particle, the one minute of, are not worth all the treasures of the world. No one has the right to crave the slightest sacrifice from my treasure, just as I do not crave such a sacrifice from anyone.
8. The school of political life is like a swimming school. Standing on the shore and listening to theoretical presentations and assumptions, no one in the world has yet learned to swim like that. Here the first thing is your own test, your own activity, your own skills and your own courage. That's what we have to teach our peasants. Let them speak for themselves, let them learn to express their own needs and wrongs, to stand behind their lusts and against their masters.
9. Language grows elementary, along with the soul of the people.
10. The literature of every nation is the best mirror of its life.
---
#### Quotes by [Ivan Kotliarevsky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_Kotliarevsky):
11. For whom lives honestly and feeds on his labors a piece of stale bread is tastier than a piece of soft one, that was untruthfully acquired.
---
#### Quotes by [Taras Shevchenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taras_Shevchenko):
12. And do not consider the moskals (// Historically a neutral designation for a person from Muscovy), let them write in their own way, and we in our own way. They have a nation and a word, and we have a nation and a word. Let people judge whose better.
---
#### Quotes by [Andrey Sheptytsky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrey_Sheptytsky):
13. No man has the natural right to rule another person against their will. Therefore, power should be formed on the basis of free and conscious elections.
14. A crime committed in the name of patriotism is the greater the crime against the people, the more it can be liked, the more it can be a reason for praise, for the consolation of what is evil. Every crime that is patriotic, the more it can be liked by badly understood patriotism is temptation, a force that leads the people to a state in which the concepts of good and evil are starting to be erased, mixed and interceded mutually. Along the way that low, poorly understood and sensual patriotism likes, contagion spreads, devouring the best, the most noblest national forces.
15. It is easier sometimes to shed blood in one wave of enthusiasm, than for many years to hardly perform duties, to bear the heat of the day and the heat of the sun, the anger of people and the hatred of enemies, the lack of their care and the lack of help from those closest to you; And in the midst of such work, until the end, to carry out your task, without waiting for laurels before the victory or rewards before the merit.
---
#### Quotes by [Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mykhailo_Kotsiubynsky):
16. I can still handle being insulted as a person, but when my people, my language, my culture are insulted, how can I not react to it?
17. It was so quiet that I felt ashamed of the pounding of my own heart.
18. The people are being eaten pranci(//alternative name of syphilis), the need and vodka, but they still eat each other in the dark.
19. I confess - I envy the planets: they have their own orbits, and nothing is standing in their way. Whereas I always meet a person in my way. // Tried my best translating, but it doesn't seem to make much sense in English, but in Ukrainian it does.
20. I am tired. I am tired of people. I am annoyed to be a place, where these creatures are crowding, screaming, fussing and littering. Open the window! Run the house! Would like to throw  away the litter along with those who litter. Let cleanliness and calmliness enter the house. What will give me the comfort of being alone? Death?

title: added Georgian quotes
body:
PS. translations aren't 100% accurate and even may not grammatically correct, but they represent core meaning:

16) It isn't a cat, to take and hang; whatever it is, it's the spirit of God, human.

17) The people, who were in a state of despair a moment ago, were now cheering and cheering. The mass of people broke up, dispersed and spread across the field. Everyone went home fully satisfied that they had seen this disgraceful and heart-wrenching game. Peter looked around and saw that no one was staying here. The army also left, only two guards remained near gallows. That red-shirted man also changed into some other clothes and left. The unfortunate child was left hanging motionless.

18) Only here ended the funeral march in four parts, which included the southern sun, the sadness of Tbilisi, the horn of a car, the noise of a propeller, the roar of a Paris coffee house, the slow rustle of Chinese silk, the boundless respect of Bromley, the envious smile of Tino, the slithering of a snake on a woman's flawless body, a secret spell and all This was surrounded by the roar of the spirit warrior Shalva. Ramino's quiet smile and the voiceless, elderly chirping, crying and sometimes speaking of her aunt, who was raised in a remote village in Georgia...

19) The bookworm, who was constantly bored, cold and obsessed with the fate of the country, gradually got her out of habit to music, singing, dancing, singing; To her madness, the laughter of love and the joy of life. As time went by, Teimuraz also got deeper and deeper into public affairs and books, day by day, he became like a bookworm and he didn't even notice Margo's heart becoming engrossed, conditioned and spiritually orphaned.

20) When Teimuraz's life bent his neck to the ground and bent him to the ground, the bent scribe also took his hand to his books - those books, which for Teimuraz were comparable to the children and were more necessary and precious than furniture, family treasures, Margot's precious stones, crockery and bed linen.

21) Yes, yes! - she heard Jacko's funny laugh, - Jacko knows that.

22) Speaking wisely is pure silver, but silence - gold

23) - Are you killing me, father? - He came to Bekina. - Are you killing me? Are you putting a knife in my throat?.. Why are you sacrificing me?!

body: Fix it automatically changing the url in the url bar (which gets requested if someone reloads the page) to https://monkeytype.com/profile/undefined (which apparently is already the username of an existing user) when going to the profile url of a non-existent user (for ex. https://monkeytype.com/profile/dfjksahjkadfsjhkasfhjkadhjksf ) , by not replacing url state unless the response status is 200

title: Adding Romanized Persian (written in English characters) support
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description

I added the romanized_persian language. Romanized Persian consists of Persian words that are written out in the Latin alphabet. It is a common tool to help teach those who are new to the language, since learning the Persian alphabet is usually a big barrier to accessibility. The words list is the same as the base Persian words list, only spelled out phonetically in the Latin alphabet. I got the OK on Discord to do this.

Closes #

Save speed stats in leaderboard update
body:
Saves a histogram data structure of speeds for buckets rounded to the nearest 10.

Signed-off-by: Brian Evans <ebrian101@gmail.com>

### Description
I have added to the leaderboard update function to save some global stats for all users.
It saves in `public` collection with type `speedStats`.
The data structure saved is:
```json
{
"type":"speedStats",
"english_time_15":{"110":1},
"english_time_60":{"90":1}
}
```

Closes #3650

title: Fixed db snapshot type
body:
Dbsnapshot for some reason didnt include `undefined` in its type definition (it will be undefined if user is not signed into an account). This pr fixes that.

It should be fine to just return / optional chain everything since in *most* cases the code in question would not even execute (it would probably be stopped by `Auth.currentUser` check) but an extra guard statement is always good. Posting as pr in case anyone thinks things might break somewhere.

title: De-emphasize unreached words in burst heatmap
body: ### Description I noticed the "unreached" words at the end of the input burst heatmap use the same styling as the median speed, which is misleading. In this test I never reached "under first": These words don't have a `.heatmap#` class so they get the default `.word` styling. This PR de-emphasizes those words:

title: [Spanish language] Word "solo" spelling mistake.
body:
### Description

Just an accent mark mistake that the Royal Spanish Academy "recently" changed its rules.  
From "sólo" to "solo".

These changes are supported by/based in: https://www.rae.es/espanol-al-dia/el-adverbio-solo-y-los-pronombres-demostrativos-sin-tilde (Official Royal Spanish Academy article).
Also can check this when trying to enter https://dle.rae.es/sólo - getting a 404 error showing that there's no word written like that in the dictionary. Only is valid when going directly to https://dle.rae.es/solo, where there is no accent mark.

It was replaced in all spanish files.
In `spanish_1k.json` and `spanish_10k.json` there was written the term with and without the accent mark, so I've replaced the incorrect form with another word in order to maintain the number of words per document.

- `Long ago, the world was nothing more than an endless sea cloaked in a boundless sky, reaching as far as could possibly be imagined. Then two great titans came into existence. The Bionis and the Mechonis. The titans were locked in a timeless battle. Until at last... Only their lifeless corpses remained.`

- `Next time you have a vision, you tell us. We bear the burden together, as a team. You have a vision you don't like, we'll change the future together.`

title: Added quotes from Porter Robinson tracks
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->
Added quotes from Porter Robinson's "Everything Goes On" and "Something Comforting" to `english.json`

_From "Everything Goes On"_
`Don't try to make yourself remember, darling. Don't look for me, I'm just a story you've been told. So let's pretend a little longer. 'Cause when we're gone, everything goes on.`

`But if I was gone tomorrow, won't the waves crash on? Is it selfish that I'm happy as we pass the setting sun? Someday I'll be overcast but you won't have to cry. 'Cause we'll do the grieving while I'm by your side.`

_From "Something Comforting"_
`Take what you want, but you're tied by the tooth. Wasn't it meant to relieve you? So suffer the signs that you needed to change. Heed all the ways you'd been thinking.`

title: Long Custom Text
body:
This PR will allow users to store progress of large custom texts on their local machine. 

Personal TODOs:
- [x] Save the current active custom text name
- [x] Ensure that the text was not modified
- [x] Expand the UI by adding a continue button for tests.
- [x] If progress is already saved, offer them the choice to continue it
- [x] If they want to continue, slice the text and load the untyped part
- [x] If they bail out, update the progress
- [x] If the text has been completed, reset the text and it's progress
- [x] Start the next test from where the last one was left out
- [x] Upon modification of a custom text, reset it's progress

Closes #3485

title: fixing wpm and correctedHistory for Korean
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->
other bug fixes and keymaping is in this draft pr: [Korean Keymap #3456](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/pull/3456)
### Fixing
- fixed wpm calculation in ``test-inputs.ts`` and ``test-stats``
- fixed Korean word compiling counting as an input in ``input-controller``.
- fixed corrected history in ``input-controller`` 
- fixed burst calculation ``test-stats``
- now handles Korean characters regardless of language.

title: Commandline to previous page on option selection
body:
### Changes
- Commandline now goes back to previous page on option selection

I thought it would be a better user experience for use cases like testing out your keyboard layout or wanting to add multiple commands at once. Personally when trying to do commands I gave up, because every time I selected an option it hid the menu. I feel like this change would encourage the use of the commandline more.

title: Change the error colour in the blue dolphin theme to make it more readable
body:
### Description


For the blue dolphin theme, when the colourful mode was used, errors were really hard to see.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66863579/186356286-5a2af56d-22ed-4c7c-bfaa-706044405637.png)

Colorful mode is on in the above image.

In the above image, the "c" is wrongly typed but it barely looks like it. The reason being the difference between the error color and the main color is too little.  Therefore I suggest a change in the colourful error colour.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66863579/186357290-f7995479-298d-4241-87cf-0931d67d5472.png)

Main colour vs **Previous** colourful error colour


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66863579/186357701-bbca21ac-98db-40a0-99a1-272a07c70cba.png)

Main colour vs **New** colourful error colour

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here's how it looks:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66863579/186359053-a5bb7fc6-3ace-4569-88ac-abbf6240b866.png)

**Before**


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66863579/186359897-c8fd9278-cf45-4d69-b91c-46237a5623e6.png)

**After**

Original colourful error : #ffbde6
New colourful error : #d1a5fd

I tried to keep it with the pastel-like colours that @vimiomori used.

title: Adding Korean Language Functionality
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description

<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->
Draft pr for words:  [adding korean to languages #3413](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/pull/3413) 
- Added Korean language: Korean (500), Korean 1k, Korean 4k (4201). 
       Based off the most commonly used words in Korean [via this list](https://ko.wiktionary.org/wiki/%EB%B6%80%EB%A1%9D:%EC%9E%90%EC%A3%BC_%EC%93%B0%EC%9D%B4%EB%8A%94_%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%96%B4_%EB%82%B1%EB%A7%90_5800)

Features:
- Added Accuracy functionality for Korean
- Added [Hangul.js ](https://github.com/e-/Hangul.js) package - [package statistics](https://bundlephobia.com/package/hangul-js@0.2.6) 
- Added input visual for Korean input. 

With Hangul.js each word was disassembled into its components and was checked with the input char.
```js
Hangul.disassemble('가나다'); // ['ㄱ','ㅏ','ㄴ','ㅏ','ㄷ','ㅏ']
```
This required edits in:
`input-controller`:
- `isCharCorrect()`
- A reference to the Korean visual div
- How input is taken in in`$("#wordsInput").on("input"...` and now passing the realInput to `handleChar()` as a rest argument. Needed because it has the untampered Korean input for the `resultingWord`.
- `handleChar()` has edits with how backspaces are handled

`test-ui`:
- `correctSoFar` logic under `updateWordElement()`

`test.html`:
-  added a div for the korean char visual as well as some styling

`test-logic`:
-  logic to turn off and on/refresh the Korean visualizer (hidden by default).

`out-of-focus`:
- added the Korean text visual to the blur class toggle

![korean](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74576449/184782092-174e5f1c-1eac-41e2-b698-6d161ab9e1a1.gif)




<!-- the issue(s) your PR resolves if any (delete if that is not the case) -->
<!-- please also reference any issues and or PRs related to your pull request -->

title: Add ReNeo supported layouts
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description

Adds 6 new layouts which are all available through the [ReNeo](https://github.com/Rojetto/ReNeo) software. New layouts total:

- [Neo](https://neo-layout.org/Layouts/neo/)
- [Bone](https://neo-layout.org/Layouts/bone/)
- [AdNW](http://www.adnw.de/index.php?n=Main.HomePage)
- [Mine](https://neo-layout.org/Layouts/mine/)

title: Implement streaks
body:
Hi,

I've added the concept of streaks.
I updated the profile page to show the user's current streak.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110681274/183287221-3783a02c-6259-4a33-8793-6b192f5259a3.png)

The streak will also affect the XP bonus, the larger the streak, the higher bonus.

I have updated the XP modifier to add the log10 calculation of the streak.
That means that a streak below 10 days will increase the modifier with 0.x, a streak below 100 will increase the modifier with 1.x, a streak below 1000 will increase the modifier with 2.x etc.

title: Added config for displaying the keymaps top row
body:
### Description

Added a setting for displaying the top key row in the keymap. 
Three options are available: always show the top row, show it depending on the layout setting or never show the top row. 

I thought this change was necessary as the top row normally pollutes the keymap but for the funbox simon says mode it is necessary to see some other characters( like the ß in qwertz).

title: WIP: Update German Language Files
body:
I noticed some of the German word being capitalised, when they should
not – unless at the start of the sentence. I believe this happened
because the sentences analysed where not normalized to fix this issue.

I believe that in monkeytype without punctuation the words should be
capitalised (or not) as if they were in the middle of a sentence. Only
if punctuation is enabled, words should get capitalized after a period.

To fix this I took a look at the original source mentioned in the
comment section of the JSON files. I wrote a script to download the
frequency map, correct capitalization, remove non-German words,
abbreviations and words from other languages.

I do not believe this list of corrections to be exhaustive and it might
need adjustments in the future. Please feel free to open a PR against
the script I used: https://github.com/Syphdias/monkeytype-generate-german

I have a few things where I need help with
1. What is preferred as a base for analysis? The source provides a frequency list for "news" and for "wikipedia". In this PR I use "news" because I felt the current words were taken from that as well. Which one would be better?
1. The guide line says to not include "swear words". With a quick search in `german_250k.json` I found at least a few obvious ones like "Arschloch" (arsehole) and "scheiße" (shit/crap). How serious is this requirement? And should I try to find a few obvious ones and filter them out? There is no guarantee that I can get all of them. What do you thin?

title: Add code julia quotes
body:
### Description
My PR is simple, I added some quotes (programs) for `code_julia`. I'm new to this repo, so please tell me if I've done everything correctly (I think I did).

title: Rewrite input system to use composition events
body:
### Description
Changed from using trailingComposeChars to using compositionstart and compositionend events to check when a composing character was entered.
This doesn't fix any of the accuracy issues for languages like Japanese, but this should be helpful for any future attempts to fix this.
Closes #2536

I've tested this on pretty much every major browser and OS, but this could possibly break some input systems I'm either unaware of or don't have access to.
These changes should ideally be tested by a few people who use input systems with accents or any type of composing characters, in case anything breaks.

title: Add GitHub funbox mode to pull words from source code on GitHub
body:
### Description

This PR adds a "GitHub" funbox mode that pulls source code from GitHub to provide words.

The code language of the files pulled from GitHub can be selected using the existing language selection, and falls back to JavaScript when the current language is not a code language. It searches for files in the top 25 most popular repositories that make use of the selected language.

Some code files have front-matter that the user must type through before getting to code. This could potentially be filtered out in the future for a more consistent experience.

The GitHub search API has has a rate limit of 10 requests a minute. This funbox makes two requests to the search API for each file, so it is low enough to be hit if someone refreshes the test a few times. Hitting the API limit hangs the website and requires a refresh, so I'd love some help figuring out a more graceful failure mode.

Uses NPM Workspaces so that types can be shared among the frontend and backend.
This removes some scripts like `install-all` because running `npm install` installs for every workspace.
Also updates some types, reorders imports, and fixes some other issues.

Overall a huge PR but most of the changes are just moving files, I understand if this PR is too much 🤣

Closes #

title: add languages: arabic_no_diacritics, arabic_no_diacritics_10k
body:
### Description

Added languages `arabic_no_diacritics`  and `arabic_no_diacritics_10k`, they are exactly the same as `arabic`  and `arabic_10k`, but with the diacritics stripped as they are rarely used in modern settings outside certain formal scenarios, (said diacritics seem to 
 have been contributed here https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/commit/68bdb6f083c157883e46be5e7a783013572dcf9e ), I tried to stick to the implied naming scheme as much as possible.

title: Fix webpack hot reload not working on html file changes.
body:
Credits to @devkennyy for leading me to mess around with webpack and fix this 

The `monkeytype.js` bundle has to be included in html files for the webpack live reload to work. I inferred this from the tests. Hence I have began including `monkeytype.js` bundle in html files in `development` mode but not in production mode.

This will provide us with the best of the both worlds as we will be able to enjoy live reload in html files in development mode and not have to bear unnecessary load on the server in production for serving javascript bundles.

title: Made fixes to ukrainian_50k
body:
### Description

Removed non-existent word: `карочє`. Available for checking by [http://sum.in.ua/s/karochje](http://sum.in.ua/s/karochje)*.

Removed vulgarisms: `порнуха` ([http://sum.in.ua/s/pornukha](http://sum.in.ua/s/pornukha)\*), `порно` ([http://sum.in.ua/s/porno](http://sum.in.ua/s/porno)\*). `порнографія`, `порнографічний`, `порнофільм` were not touched as legit.

Removed `культурно-розважальний` as a complex word, which is actually consists of two words ("cultural-and-entertainment").

\* [Online version](http://sum.in.ua/) of "[Slovnyk ukrayins’koyi movy v 11 tomah (SUM-11)](https://uk.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA_%D1%83%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%97%D0%BD%D1%81%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%97_%D0%BC%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B8_%D0%B2_11_%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B0%D1%85)" ("Ukrainian language dictionary in 11 volumes (SUM-11)").

title: Custom Filters [FrontEnd]
body:
As recommended by @Bruception , This PR is for the FrontEnd and will ovveride #3084 
NOTE: I will rebase this pr onto main once #3105 is merged, so ignore the backend changes in the pr, they are from the previous pr

### Description

"As a user i would like to be able to save filter configurations to be able to generate mutiple reports"

This PR allows users to create custom filters, which are just `ResultFilter` instances.
Previously the front end would store the `ResultFilter` in the local storage on the browser, however this means only 1 filter can be saved, and it is constantly overriden.
This PR now stores these custom filters in the backend database.

### UPDATED UI AND FLOW:

#### Updated flow:
- When the user clicks on the preset button, the filter preset section opens up
- The user can click on “save filter as preset” which will prompt them to select a name
- When the user clicks on an existing preset, the preset button is highlighted and the filters are set to the preset
- When the user changes the filters in any way (time frame, language, mode etc) the custom filter button is deselected, as the applied filters are no longer matching the preset 
- When a user selects a preset and its button is highlighted, the “delete preset” button appears
- When the user presses on the delete button, the preset is deleted


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26475724/173274961-a31f2989-cb9a-452c-a75f-949705ad7d85.mp4

title: Custom Filters [Backend]
body:
As recommended by @Bruception , This PR is for the Backend and will ovveride #3084 

### Description

"As a user i would like to be able to save filter configurations to be able to generate mutiple reports"

This PR allows users to create custom filters, which are just `ResultFilter` instances.
Previously the front end would store the `ResultFilter` in the local storage on the browser, however this means only 1 filter can be saved, and it is constantly overriden.
This PR now stores these custom filters in the backend database.

# Creating a filter:
- The user can click on "new filter" at any time and this will create a new custom filter based on the current filters applied.
- The user will be prompted to name the filter

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26475724/172541220-47027be5-58a5-49a1-b5f8-36dd72f85b72.mp4


# Applying a custom filter:
- The front end gets all the user's triggers, and if the user clicks on one of them, the filter is applied.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26475724/172541380-bf89229f-f025-4f6b-bec4-34294cc6c2f3.mp4


# Deleting a custom filter:
- When a user is selecting a custom filter, the delete button is dsiplayed
- The user can click this button to permanently delete a custom filter

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26475724/172541486-3a2cb819-e32c-4b3e-9f62-6519921123d8.mp4

title: Add an option for Arabic without diacritics
body:
### Description

In the modern day, most people (and by people I mean Arabic natives) do not type Arabic with its diacritics because they can simply be inferred. If you look at most Arabic text on the internet, you will notice that it is lacking these features present in both Arabic and Arabic 10k. This version of Arabic uses Arabic 10k, minus the diacritics; the only exceptions to these are ً ، ٍ ، and ٌ  since they are still written in text (they're all slightly different, but they add an 'n' sound at the end on top of modifying the pronunciation). 

There are a few odd pieces of text here and there that still make use of it, and every instance of the Qu'ran that you can find will be using them (pronunciation is important there!), but in general, people do not use them.

title: Changed dark magic girl caret color for visibility issues
body: ### Description Since the caret color and the sub color of the theme "dark magic girl" is the same `#93e8d3`, the block caret made it impossible for the user to see the which character they are typing. Therefore I have changed the caret color to the text color `#a288d9` so that the current character is visible again: ### BEFORE ### AFTER

title: adds language validation check
body:
### Description
I created this script to check the 'quality' of the language files by counting all duplicates and calculating a duplicate percentage. It might be useful in enforcing properly populated word lists in the future. I did not add it to the `compile-production` task yet as the validation will fail due to russian_10k consisting of ten copies of russian_1k (90% duplicate rate).

title: Make min accuracy more intuitive
body:
### Description

I have changed min accuracy mode to have three choices: off, standard, and strict. 
In strict mode, if your accuracy ever falls below the target accuracy, you instantly fail. (The calculation is now done every time a key is pressed instead of based on the timer.
In standard mode, there is a bit of grace given. Grace is given in two ways:
1. Making a single mistake on a test will never fail you. You must make at least two mistakes to fail. 
2. If you drop below your target accuracy, but getting the next word (next 5 characters) correct would bring you back above, you do not fail.

title: Add CONTRIBUTING_BASIC.md and CONTRIBUTING_ADVANCED.md
body:
### Description

I've refactored the contribution guide into a basic and advanced version. 

`CONTRIBUTING.md` now has a section to help refer potential contributors to the right guide for the change they're trying to make. Most of the content has moved to the advanced contribution guide, but I've kept the guidelines here (open to suggestions on where these should go).

`CONTRIBUTING_BASIC.md` goes through how to use either the VS Code web editor or the Github Web UI to make commits directly through their browser, and open PRs.

`CONTRIBUTING_ADVANCED.md` is mostly a duplicate of the previous state of `CONTRIBUTING.md`, minus sections that stayed in the original file, and minus sections that are no longer relevant. 

Closes #2629 

https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/issues/2629

title: Defaults analytics to be unchecked
body:
To conform with GDPR, analytics **MUST** be opt-in, and disabled by default.

For reference, in the UK's guidance on GDPR compliance:

> Consent requires a positive opt-in. Don’t use pre-ticked boxes or any other method of default consent.

https://ico.org.uk/for-organisations/guide-to-data-protection/guide-to-the-general-data-protection-regulation-gdpr/?template=pdf&patch=97#link14

So I removed the tag that makes the analytics consent checkbox checked by default.

I was quite shocked that this free software project was asking me for consent to analytics. I'm glad I was informed, but noticed this mistake immediately when I went to reject them.

title: Fixes Javascript typo (#2884)
body:
### Description

As a frequent user of the Javascript Code prompt, this is just a small nitpick that's been bugging me (pun intended 🙂) for a while. There is no `ondbclick` method or property in the Javascript language. This PR simply fixes the typo in the `code_javascript.json` file to change `ondbclick` to the corrected `ondblclick`.

MDN Link:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GlobalEventHandlers/ondblclick

I checked `code_javascript_1k.json` to make sure the typo didn't occur in that file, and confirmed that `ondbclick` only exists in `code_javascript.json`.

Love this product and happy to help in any way I can. Please let me know if I missed anything!

Closes #2884

title: Replace "sorani" with "kurdish_central"
body:
This replaces the less-common and non-standard term "sorani" with "kurdish(central)". The term "sorani" is not used in official documents of governments, and neither too much in casual people talk. Even ISO doesn’t use that term: its 639-3 code, `ckb`, stands for (C)entral (K)urdish (B)ranch.

Even me, I personally would have never known that Kurdish is available in the game until I scrolled through all of the languages. When I searched for "Kurd..", I didn’t get any result.

title: Add Language - Latin
body:
### Description

Addition of the Latin language.

Language comprised of the most common ~150 Latin words, and some of their forms for variety.
(such as magnus, magna & magnum rather than magnus alone)

Total unique word count: 360

Referenced from here: https://dcc.dickinson.edu/latin-core-list1
I do study Latin myself, so I am not copying blindly.

An example of a line as would be seen on the website:
> paro modo cepi tanta uti magnus veni sub de nostrum

Thank you for your consideration.

title: Added sub alt color, fixed various styling inconsistencies
body:
Added sub alt color to all themes and custom themes. This color is mainly used to color buttons and even table rows. It is replacing the current approach of setting those elements to `rgba(0,0,0,0.1)` which was problematic with very dark themes - boundaries of buttons were invisible. 

Made the button styling more consistent and fixed focus styling. Also fixed some other various HTML inconsistencies. 

Also removed `icon-button` class in favour of just using `button` and `text-button`.

Closes #2744

title: Added Arabic language without tashkeel (Making Arabic usable)
body:
Arabic Is a very complicated language, there is something in Arabic called "Tashkeel", which are modifiers to the word, so the word itself has the same characters, but different modifiers change it's meaning and pronunciation.

Most of people using Arabic nowadays don't use Tashkeel unless they are journalists or something, but the original Arabic you had on the website was only limited to Tashkeel which made it literally unusable for most of the Arab users including me.

So I copied the existing Arabic database I found on the repo and put it in python, looped over all words and removed Tashkeel form them so that they are usable for the Majority of Arabs, then added the data back into a proper Json file.

Let me know If you have more questions about this, I told my friend about it and he will modify the 10 K Arabic version also found on the repo, so that the 10 K version will also be usable, we hope that you don't remove the Tashkeel version because some people will find it helpful even tho the majority will use the Vanilla version.

note: I told my friend because we are CS students :) and there is a bonus mark on doing a contribution to an existing app.

title: Decreased filesize and introduced chunk splitting
body:
- Decreased final production scripts size by 15% by de duplicating bn.js in webpack.
- Started splitting dependencies into their own chunk. This will enable caching for them and save valuable resources since deps aren't changed regularly. 
- Added HTML webpack plugin to dynamically add chunkhash to scripts.

From this:
![Before Bundle Analyzer Output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69350358/159103683-399e6e30-dee3-4c2e-a1e8-9a10f6a8ec6b.png)

To This:
![After Bundle Analyzer Output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69350358/159106377-9dd00171-b524-475a-a2da-a6f362a26565.png)

title: Updated Nepali Language and Added Nepali Quotes.
body:
[+] Added Nepali Quotes.
[-] Removed some words that had similar meaning but was different due to Nepali language having different word for different kind of people (Elder, Younger, Friends, Parents, etc).
[-] Removed some letters from words which had no meaning while typing in single word like हाम्रोमा(in ours) and हाम्रो(ours), word मा is removed.
[=] Words are arranged in alphabetical order to make easier incase someone wants to check either there is grammatical error.
[+] Added `,"nepali_1k"` in `_list.json`.
[+] Added `"nepali_1k"` in nepali list of `_group.json`.

title: Add Custom Layouts
body:
### Description

This pull request adds custom layouts. You can have up to 5 custom layouts stored at a time. You can add/edit/remove these layouts in the behavior settings group. Clicking on the button in the settings page automatically sets that layout as the layout emulator. The custom layouts are added to the layoutlist so they can be used like any built-in layout.

TODO:
- [ ] Style the layout editor better (so that the keys resemble the default keymap) (NEED HELP).
- [ ] Do a lot of testing.
- [ ] Only support for one or decrease the amount supported according to Mio's suggestions.

Closes #2182

title: Some Config Validation Fixes
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description

<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->

This PR does the following: 
 - allows for between 2 and 5 layouts for custom layoutfluid,
 - added `isConfigValueValidAsync` that returns a promise.
 - moves custom layoutfluid layout validation to the `isConfigValueValidAsync` function.
 - makes an asynchronous `some` function for the `isConfigValueValidAsync` function.
 - removes all `undefined` and `null` checks from the set functions because that's handled by the validator and `undefined` cannot be passed into the set functions (in ts anyway) due to the parameters not having `undefined` as an option. The `apply` function automatically assigns default values for missing properties.
 - Fixes spelling errors.
 - adds boolean to the validator for some set functions that have it in the param type.
 - convert `any` to `unknown`

Closes #2557

<!-- the issue(s) your PR resolves if any (delete if that is not the case) -->
<!-- please also reference any issues and or PRs related to your pull request -->

title: feat(cmd): Add command to choose a quote
body:
### Description

This PR aims to add a command to the commandline that allows the user to pick a specific quote. When a quote is selected, the mode will be switched to 'custom' and the custom text will be set to the text of the respective quote.

The currently selected language will be considered in the options the user is given for selecting a quote in the submenu.


### Known Problems

- The options are only adapted to the language the first time the site loads
  (-> doesn't reflect language changes without reloading)
  **Requires generating the options before the submenu is opened - is that even currently possible in the command line? Also performance?**
- The site seems to become "laggy" the 2nd time a quote is selected?
- Whatever is happening here in the last element of the list
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56218513/154781022-532911a1-319a-450c-970f-66206bc042f9.png)
  (Potentially the command line understandably just not being made for this many options?)



### More Information

When the first "known problem" is fixed, I assume that the same solution could be used to also consider the currently selected quote length when generating the quote options for the submenu.

## Part of #2430 (setting up compilation)
- installed typescript at the top level package.json (because both frontend and backend will be using typescript)
- added tsconfig in backend
- added build script to backend package.json
- fixed minor typescript compilation errors (eg calling `.toString()`)
- migrated to ES modules (changed to import export syntax)
- added typing for anticheat

title: chore: updated node/npm versions
body: Updated node and npm versions to be `16.13.2` and `8.1.2` as per Miodec's request.

title: Add TypeScript compilation for frontend TypeScript and add index.ts
body:
### Description

This should add frontend TypeScript compilation to the gulpfile. All the TypeScript tasks and npm scripts are completely separate from the JavaScript tasks so this shouldn't change anything with the website currently. Just a building block towards the frontend TypeScript. The `tsconfig.json` is not complete by any means.

Closes #

title: Feat:Update response structure
body:
### Here is short description what I have done in this PR
* Create a MonkeyResponse class that build response structure.
* instead of return res.status(code).json({}) from controllers now we are using return new MonkeyResponse(statusCode, message, data)
* Return both message and data in case of GET route and only message in all other case.

body:

<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->

title: Fix bug that prevented sw cache from being deleted
body:
### Description
Multiple things are occuring in this pr, all related to the service worker and caching system
*  Added `event.waitUntil(self.skipWaiting());` and `event.waitUntil(self.clients.claim());`
   * These functions stop old service workers and allow the new service worker to take control
     * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41009167/what-is-the-use-of-self-clients-claim 
*  Placed delete caches inside of "activate" event.
   *  Caches should be removed and clients.claim() should be run when the sw is activated (first loaded)
* Open cache by name before checking and setting cache for better precision
* Removed "monkeytype.com" and "localhost:5000" from nocache list.
  * Now that sw.js is updated after each build and new files are requested, we don't have to request new ones if there was a bad file in an older version
* Stopped updating /static/sw.js on compile.
  * When gulp compile was run, the sw.js file in the static folder was updated. When watching files for updates in dev mode, updating static/sw.js causes the program to rebuild infinitely.
  * You could create a simple gulp task to copy sw from dist to static and add to build series if you think it's important to commit, but I don't think it's necessary
