title: Bump node-fetch from 2.6.1 to 3.1.1
body:
Bumps [node-fetch](https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch) from 2.6.1 to 3.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from node-fetch's releases.

v3.1.1

Security patch release

Recommended to upgrade, to not leak sensitive cookie and authentication header information to 3th party host while a redirect occurred

What's Changed

  • core: update fetch-blob by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1371
  • docs: Fix typo around sending a file by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1381
  • core: (http.request): Cast URL to string before sending it to NodeJS core by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1378
  • core: handle errors from the request body stream by @​mdmitry01 in node-fetch/node-fetch#1392
  • core: Better handle wrong redirect header in a response by @​tasinet in node-fetch/node-fetch#1387
  • core: Don't use buffer to make a blob by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1402
  • docs: update readme for TS @​types/node-fetch by @​adamellsworth in node-fetch/node-fetch#1405
  • core: Fix logical operator priority to disallow GET/HEAD with non-empty body by @​maxshirshin in node-fetch/node-fetch#1369
  • core: Don't use global buffer by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1422
  • ci: fix main branch by @​dnalborczyk in node-fetch/node-fetch#1429
  • core: use more node: protocol imports by @​dnalborczyk in node-fetch/node-fetch#1428
  • core: Warn when using data by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1421
  • docs: Create SECURITY.md by @​JamieSlome in node-fetch/node-fetch#1445
  • core: don't forward secure headers to 3th party by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1449

New Contributors

  • @​mdmitry01 made their first contribution in node-fetch/node-fetch#1392
  • @​tasinet made their first contribution in node-fetch/node-fetch#1387
  • @​adamellsworth made their first contribution in node-fetch/node-fetch#1405
  • @​maxshirshin made their first contribution in node-fetch/node-fetch#1369
  • @​JamieSlome made their first contribution in node-fetch/node-fetch#1445

Full Changelog: https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/compare/v3.1.0...v3.1.1

v3.1.0

What's Changed

  • fix(Body): Discourage form-data and buffer() by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1212
  • fix: Pass url string to http.request by @​serverwentdown in node-fetch/node-fetch#1268
  • Fix octocat image link by @​lakuapik in node-fetch/node-fetch#1281
  • fix(Body.body): Normalize Body.body into a node:stream by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#924
  • docs(Headers): Add default Host request header to README.md file by @​robertoaceves in node-fetch/node-fetch#1316
  • Update CHANGELOG.md by @​jimmywarting in node-fetch/node-fetch#1292
  • Add highWaterMark to cloned properties by @​davesidious in node-fetch/node-fetch#1162
  • Update README.md to fix HTTPResponseError by @​thedanfernandez in node-fetch/node-fetch#1135
  • docs: switch url to URL by @​dhritzkiv in node-fetch/node-fetch#1318
  • fix(types): declare buffer() deprecated by @​dnalborczyk in node-fetch/node-fetch#1345
  • chore: fix lint by @​dnalborczyk in node-fetch/node-fetch#1348

title: added tashkeel stripped virsion for arabic files
body:
The Arabic files available are with tashkeel which is kind of symbols that are used to recognize words but not used in every day so I made a script that is removing tashkeel for those whom want to practice without it and add the stripped files with change in list and groups files
``` python

from pyarabic.araby import strip_tashkeel
import json
file = 'arabic.json' #file name with assumtion that you are runnig code in same folder
target_file  = file.replace('.json','tashkeel_stipped.json')
print(target_file)
with open(file,'r+') as f:
    data = json.load(f)
    data['name'] = target_file.replace('.json','')
    for idx,word in enumerate(data['words']):
        data['words'][idx] = strip_tashkeel( data['words'][idx])
with open(target_file,'w') as tf:
    json.dump(data,tf,indent=4,ensure_ascii = False)
    print('done')
```

title: Extend code_python.json (dunder methods and libraries)
body:
### Description

In this PR I added some new words to Python code file, including dunder magic methods and some useful libraries that are often imported.

title: Offline mode (with localStorage snapshot)
body:
### Description

Set monkeytype into offline mode if getDataAndInit fails. Tests that cannot be uploaded are saved to localStorage and updated once monkeytype is started without offline mode. This commit differs from a pr I opened earlier today because now dbSnapshot is saved in localStorage, making it accessible offline.

title: Offline mode
body:
### Description
Set monkeytype into offline mode if getDataAndInit fails. Tests that cannot be uploaded are saved to localStorage and updated once monkeytype is started without offline mode.

Not sure what to do about user account/snapshot in offline mode. You could save the snapshot to localStorage when online so it persists in online mode, but this would require double the space and write operations.

title: Bump follow-redirects from 1.14.4 to 1.14.7
body:
Bumps [follow-redirects](https://github.com/follow-redirects/follow-redirects) from 1.14.4 to 1.14.7.
Commits
  • 2ede36d Release version 1.14.7 of the npm package.
  • 8b347cb Drop Cookie header across domains.
  • 6f5029a Release version 1.14.6 of the npm package.
  • af706be Ignore null headers.
  • d01ab7a Release version 1.14.5 of the npm package.
  • 40052ea Make compatible with Node 17.
  • 86f7572 Fix: clear internal timer on request abort to avoid leakage
  • 2e1eaf0 Keep Authorization header on subdomain redirects.
  • 2ad9e82 Carry over Host header on relative redirects (#172)
  • See full diff in compare view

I created a keyboard layout based on Dvorak (right hand homerow and r, a and e and some stray keys I could keep in the same positions), Whorf (left hand index is a mirror of Whorf's) and Dwarf (vowel columns) which I think is pretty good. It'd be great if it could be on here :)

body:
### Description

Adds Spanish QWERTY and Dvorak keyboard layouts.

title: Implemented screenshot fix
body:
### Description

I increased the default screenshot padding in test-ui.js. This was done to patch the issue with the screenshot content exceeding the width of the image. I also made the html2canvas element's position get calculated by two padding variables.

Closes #2054

(This is my first pull request with code to a public repository ever, so please tell me if I need to do anything different) :)

title: remove css/media-queries.css
body:
### Description
`index.html` was trying to get the `css/media-queries.css` stylesheet, which does not exist. I removed the line from `index.html` that was requesting it.

title: Clear sw-cache if localhost or new version
body:
### Description
Because `sw.js` doesn't check if it's cache is equal to the server's files, cache is not updated when a new version of the site's files are released. Fixed this by clearing cache on page load if working on localhost or 127.0.0.1 and clearing cache if a new version was released on Github.

title: Replaced call to nonexistent function Misc.countAllKeys
body:
### Description
Load result filters calls a nonexistent function Misc.countAllKeys, causing it to error every time. I'm not completely certain what countAllKeys did but my best guess is that it counts the number of keys in a json object. I replaced the function call with code that counts the number of keys in the object, fixing the issue.

title: Correct button text animations
body:
## Description
Css properties of button text were set to `transform: 0.25s`. This is invalid and `transition: 0.25s` is likely what the code was intended to say.

![Screenshot from 2022-01-01 15-30-52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47042841/147859628-45bd5b98-9887-4d77-bc8b-c59d44173ca0.png)

title: update sw.js to properly cache and request
body:
### Description

The previous version of the service-worker did not cache any resources other than `index.html`. This version checks where the request is asking for data from and decides to request normally if accessing an api serving dynamic data and caches data returned from routes that are not an api serving dynamic data.

title: chores: fix typo and push backend/credentials directory
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description

* Fixes a typo in `CONTRIBUTING.md`. (Missing whitespace.)
* Adds `.gitkeep` under `backend/credentials` so users don't have to create the directory themselves.

The `.gitkeep` change is up for debate, since that's not an official Git thing. Many projects add a `.gitkeep` file to push directories required for development, though. In my opinion, it'd be nice since the directory is required anyway. Let me know if you want me to remove that commit, though. (freeCodeCamp article on the topic: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/what-is-gitkeep/)

title: wikipedia funbox with current group language
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description

The wikipedia funbox is a great feature but it's only for english language.
I added a support for spanish, french, german, portuguese, italian and dutch.

The language group is associate with the appropriate TLD for the wikipedia request.
I haven't included other language because I'm not sure if the wikipedia text is correct or "typable" in these langages.

Maybe it could be helpfull to add this tld information in the _groups.js structure in the futur, instead of a big switch in the fonction. But this data in not really usefull outside of the wikipedia funbox.

I removed the "remove non ascii" part because it deletes lot of diacritics.
In my opinion, it's better to have to skip sometime than have to type non-sense words. 
sectionText = sectionText.replace(/[\u{0080}-\u{10FFFF}]/gu, "");

An alternative could be cleaning the wikipedia input with some specific regex for each language to match the corpus. 

Closes #

title: Completely Fix Wikipedia Spacing
body:
### Description I don't know if what I'm doing isn't great practice but what I'm doing is not taking Wikipedia's way of turning the HTML into text and instead asking for the HTML (removing `explaintext=true` in the URL). Then I replace every instance where there's a new paragraph (`

`) with a space, and convert the HTML back into text. One problem I see with this is that if there's a pronunciation or a measure with a unit it will remove the space between it (eg. 12 km -> 12km) . This does consistently add the space between paragraphs and does not confuse acronyms, though. Closes #2112 and extends on PR [#2193](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/pull/2193)

title: Fix for Wikipedia newline issue
body:
### Description
This PR uses regex to try and replace the missing gap in the wikipedia text. It looks for a word or number that is at least three characters long (to prevent "PH.D" being picked up), followed by a "." followed by a letter (not a number to prevent decimals being picked up). This however is not fool proof, as I have discovered that wikipedia articles are the mother of edge cases and so when I was testing I got this problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49330942/146655672-a61390ee-530c-42c1-801d-99e81809d223.png)
(The arrow is just so that I know that it was my regex that is changing the text, it is a space in the pr)

I don't think that this properly solves the issue and I don't think that any amount of regex will be able to get all the edge cases but I would say that this is better than before.

Closes #2112

This PR adds a button that will retry to save a result that has failed to save. The red redo button only shows up when a test has failed to save and will hide itself again when the result has saved. title: Add Spanish with no accent marks language
body: In the Spanish language, certain words need to have an accent mark over a vowel, for example in the word "también". The accented vowels look like this: á, é, í, ó, ú. In the Spanish keyboard layout we have a dedicated key that we have to press before a vowel in order to put the accent mark on it. So for the word "también" we have to type the sequence of keys " t a m b i ´ e n ". As you can probably tell, it is very common to miss that accent mark and just write "tambien" (with no accent mark). This is technically a typo, but in a non professional or casual context people won't mind about that mistake. That's why I took the spanish.json as a baseline and created the spanish_no_accents.json file. The difference is that the words don't have accent marks. The main reason for this change is that it's very frequent to miss the accent mark on a vowel while doing a typing test, and that counts as an error. I think that with this change, lazy Spanish people like me would be really happy!

This theme is based off GMK Mecha_01. It's color scheme is Bright orange, Indigo and Chartreuse green. title: Enable PWA
body:
### Description
Website is now an installable Progressive Web App. I've only added the minimum necessary files to allow the site to be installed locally. Explanations for what I did and why can be found at https://mobiforge.com/design-development/pwa-minimus-a-minimal-pwa-checklist. 

Basically, the site just works outside of the browser, no extra functionality added. You can still type offline because the site files have been cached, but a red alert saying script error shows up on page load. Haven't really dug into it but it looks like the tests might be uploaded once connection is restored. 

Edit: I'm an idiot, offline doesn't work. I was running on localhost, so when I turned wifi off, it still worked because localhost doesn't depend on wireless connection.

Also, a better 512x512 icon should probably be added as well as more sizes, I just upscaled the favicon to make a single 512 icon.

#### Closes
#1018 and similarly #1051 #2036 #2126

body:

title: Settings from URL
body:
This PR builds from what was done in #1394 and also probably closes #1394.

You can add parameters to URL that if recognized will be applied to settings.

The `?` separates settings from the rest of the URL and `&` separates settings from each other. Each setting has key as its name followed by `=` and the desired value.
Example URL might look like this `https://monkeytype.com/?mode=words&words=25&difficulty=normal` or like this `/?mode=custom&custom=Hi|hi|hi!`.

Pressing `Esc` when `quoteSearchPopup` was open would open command line instead of closing the popup.
Pressing `Esc` when `customWordAmountPopup` or `customTestDurationPopup` was open would result in an error as the calling method couldn't see CustomWordAmountPopup.hide() method
This should fix that.

title: Run GitHub action on merges to master
body:
### Description
Not as good as what we wanted but at least this one works.

1. Merge pull request
2. Action auto-formats with Prettier
    * Commits directly to master under "GitHub Actions" name, right after merge commit.
        * This can cause problems if multiple actions run at the same time, as some actions will be left behind and won't be able to push. The [concurrency](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#concurrency) field I set partially solves this, but currently it only allows having up to 1 action in the queue, so if you merge more than 2 PRs at the same time some of the actions will be dropped. If you don't merge many PRs at the same time this won't be a problem.
3.  Lints everything. If it finds an error, nothing will be changed but you'll receive an e-mail telling you something's wrong and you'll have to check it out manually.

Edit: You'll have to constantly be pulling from master to catch up with the action's commit. I can understand if you don't like this approach and would rather auto-format manually (or not at all).

Edit 2: Actually, I'm not sure if github bots have more power and can push to fork pull requests? Maybe we could run a bot in the same instance as the site database and have that one auto format and even comment on people's PRs? I'll have to look into that.

EditorConfig is a configuration file to standardize file format settings across editors. Most code editors have the ability to use it natively while others have community plugins.

* [VSCode plugin available here](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=EditorConfig.EditorConfig)
* [Plugins for other editors available here](https://editorconfig.org/#download)

See the [EditorConfig homepage](https://editorconfig.org/) for more information.

For now I just added configuration for indentation size and format, and I think that's pretty much all we're gonna need. They are the only things I had to constantly set up when opening my editor to work on Monkeytype, and with EditorConfig it's automatic :)

title: Add .nvmrc file and updated Node.js installation instructions
body:
### Description

`nvm` is a tool used for handling multiple versions of Node.js on a user's machine. Adding an `.nvmrc` file allows contributors using `nvm` to quickly switch to the version of Node.js that Monkeytype supports, and also warns them if they do not have that version installed. This is a relatively small change, but can make development on Monkeytype easier for Node.js developers who contribute to multiple projects.

The proposed standardized version of Node.js in the `.nvmrc` file is set to v14, but please let me know if the team prefers to use a different one for development with Monkeytype.

title: Make Tab and Esc behavior consistent even with swap
body:
Edit: This PR also refactors and cleans up some messy code I left in after input rewrite

---

When typing in zen mode or a quote that contains a tab character:
### Before
#### No swapEscAndTab
* **Tab**: Inputs tab character
    * **Shift + Tab**: Selects restart button (or restarts with quick tab)
* **Escape**: Opens command line

All good.

#### With swapEscAndTab
* **Tab**: Opens command line
* **Escape**: Inputs tab character
    * **Shift + Escape**: Selects restart button (or restarts with quick tab)

Makes sense, it literally "swaps" all of their behavior, but is unintuitive.

### After
#### No swapEscAndTab
Same as before.

#### With swapEscAndTab
* **Tab**: Inputs tab character
    * **Shift + Tab**: Opens command line
* **Escape**: Selects restart button (or restarts with quick tab)

Main functionality is swapped, but Tab still inserts a tab character. More intuitive.

title: Add Estonian
body:
# Description

## Source

The source of the list is from the [Institute of the Estonian Language](http://www.eki.ee/tarkvara/wordlist/) and is relying on the [2013 list](http://www.eki.ee/tarkvara/wordlist/soned2013.txt).

## Filters

Filtered words that are longer than 1 character to avoid including abbreviations like `m`, `s`, etc, though other slightly longer abbreviations still exist, such as AS, OÜ, etc: `awk 'length($1) != 1 { print }' soned2013.txt | sort -r -g -k 2`.

I've also kept any capitalization that existed in the original list as to stay true to any possible names, locations or anything else, and to not do too much possibly opinionated filtering where not required.

## Output

- `estonian.json` contains top 200 most commonly used words
- `estonian_1k.json` contains everything above, plus 800 additional common words
- `estonian_10k.json` contains everything above, plus 9000 additional common words

title: Exclude ñ from lazy mode
body:
<!-- Adding a language or a theme?
For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well.
 For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps!

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot.

 -->

### Description
Removed ñ from lazy mode conversion to n. 

Addresses #1937

According to [WIkipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%91):
> Unlike many other letters that use diacritic marks (such as Ü in Catalan and Spanish and Ç in Catalan, French and Portuguese), Ñ in Spanish, Galician, Basque, Asturian, Leonese, Guarani and Filipino is considered a letter in its own right, has its own name (in Spanish: eñe), and its own place in the alphabet (after N). Historically it came from a superscript abbreviation for a doubled N. Its alphabetical independence is similar to the Germanic W, which came from a doubled V.

Looks like it's a key in every layout of languages that use it.

title: Separate Arabic words with diacritics
body:
### Description

Recent changes have made it impossible to practice Arabic without diacritics. Since most of the Arabic typed is without diacritics (or in some cases minimal diacritics), these recent changes severely reduces the usability of the site for what most Arabic users want to practice. This change splits the word list into those with and without diacritics. This gives the user the flexibility to decide how they want to practice.

title: Added words to british english and removed hyphens
body:
### Description

This pr adds all the words from the english 10k changes list in #958 and also removes the hyphenated words from the british english list. 

I think that while the hyphens are more correct, they are also more correct in american english, so the british english list is not the place to make this change. Although I think that it is best to stick with no hyphens because hyphens are not fun to type. 

I have also removed some British variants of words from american english lists although this is by no means thorough, the best way to get rid of these may be to create a script that uses the british english words in the list and searches for them in the american english lists, but I have no experience working with json. 

I will look into merging the 450k list from #958 with the current one but the words are placed in the list ["british", "american"] which is the wrong order, is there a way of easily flipping this around? It will take a lot of work to check through the 450k list however so it will be quite some time before I am able to get a finished list from it even once I have it flipped around.

title: Corrections to British English
body:
### Description

I have removed many incorrect changes that were made with the list of differences between the normal english and british english. I have also corrected changes where appropriate and also added mom --> mum

There were a few changes that I have not made yet but I would like people's opinions on:
- While gramme is usually considered to be the british spelling of the word, gram is more commonly used
- While sulphur is generally consider to be the british form, sulfur is used by IUPAC and also many institutions such as most (if not all) uk exam boards

Also many words seem to be North America only with no direct parallel in british english, in the future will there be a way of just removing these from the word selection?

In situations where I found that multiple spellings of a word were valid in both american and british english, I tried to use the spelling already in use by the english language.

title: Bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2
body:
Bumps [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios) from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2.
Release notes

Sourced from axios's releases.

v0.21.2

0.21.2 (September 4, 2021)

Fixes and Functionality:

  • Updating axios requests to be delayed by pre-emptive promise creation (#2702)
  • Adding "synchronous" and "runWhen" options to interceptors api (#2702)
  • Updating of transformResponse (#3377)
  • Adding ability to omit User-Agent header (#3703)
  • Adding multiple JSON improvements (#3688, #3763)
  • Fixing quadratic runtime and extra memory usage when setting a maxContentLength (#3738)
  • Adding parseInt to config.timeout (#3781)
  • Adding custom return type support to interceptor (#3783)
  • Adding security fix for ReDoS vulnerability (#3980)

Internal and Tests:

  • Updating build dev dependancies (#3401)
  • Fixing builds running on Travis CI (#3538)
  • Updating follow rediect version (#3694, #3771)
  • Updating karma sauce launcher to fix failing sauce tests (#3712, #3717)
  • Updating content-type header for application/json to not contain charset field, according do RFC 8259 (#2154)
  • Fixing tests by bumping karma-sauce-launcher version (#3813)
  • Changing testing process from Travis CI to GitHub Actions (#3938)

Documentation:

  • Updating documentation around the use of AUTH_TOKEN with multiple domain endpoints (#3539)
  • Remove duplication of item in changelog (#3523)
  • Fixing gramatical errors (#2642)
  • Fixing spelling error (#3567)
  • Moving gitpod metion (#2637)
  • Adding new axios documentation website link (#3681, #3707)
  • Updating documentation around dispatching requests (#3772)
  • Adding documentation for the type guard isAxiosError (#3767)
  • Adding explanation of cancel token (#3803)
  • Updating CI status badge (#3953)
  • Fixing errors with JSON documentation (#3936)
  • Fixing README typo under Request Config (#3825)
  • Adding axios-multi-api to the ecosystem file (#3817)
  • Adding SECURITY.md to properly disclose security vulnerabilities (#3981)

Huge thanks to everyone who contributed to this release via code (authors listed below) or via reviews and triaging on GitHub:

title: Fix bug in update name time limit
body:
I noticed that the rate limit for changing name on account was incorrectly set to 30 days in seconds, but Date.now() returns milliseconds, so the limit would actually be 0.03 days instead of the intended 30 days.

The only thing I've changed is multiplied the delay by a thousand so that its in milliseconds.

```
30 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
>> 2592000000
```

title: Add exit condition for username loop
body:
### Description
<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->
When user uses Google Sign In to login for the first time, he is prompted to choose a username. If prompt is closed (cancel pressed), request is sent with `{name: null}`. Check fails and prompt reappears. User is now stuck in this loop, unless a valid username is provided. There might be reasons why user would choose not to proceed with this, so let's provide an option not to. If prompt is closed, break the loop and sign out.

title: Added a delimiter switch
body:
Adding a new feature, Delimiter Switch in custom text mode.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55594298/130465677-8ac71355-e95a-4766-9ceb-2ed8145e2be9.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55594298/130465733-d1544669-c871-4967-8d44-af757abd60cf.png)


### Description

Added a switch on the custom text popup, that toggles between a space delimiter and a pipe delimiter. It would allow users to randomise phrases (for example "big house|test|increase|other"). With this, the words "big" and "house" will always occur together.


Closes #1728

title: Ctrl/Cmd+Shift+P as an alternate way to open command line
body:
Added ability to open the command line with ctrl+shift+p. This change allows Monkeytypers to use the command line while in full screen. Previously, when attempting to use the command line in full screen, pressing `esc` would just exit full screen and the command line would not open. 


**note: code is untested as my Gitpod container autodeletes Firebase for some reason, need to change the Docker image cause I really don't want to install, login and reconfigure Firebase every time.** Also note that keyCode is now [deprecated](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/keyCode) so might want to remove and refactor that in the future.

Closes #1731

title: Pseudolang funbox mode - gibberish, but more wordlike
body: ### Description **NOTE:** I'm not sure whether this is a good idea. It seemed fun so I thought I'd share it, but it's totally up to you whether to do anything with it. Generates random words using ngram distributions from the current language. The result is gibberish (I originally called it "gibberish" before I realized that was already the name of a funbox mode) but with similar patterns to real language.

title: Improvements to weakspot.
body:
Gets rid of `defaultScore` (which was hacky), instead makes the learning rate faster at the start so that it's a simple mean for the first `perCharCount` of each letter and an exponential average afterwards. Chars that haven't been seen at all don't contribute to a word's score.

The effect should be that it seems "fairer" with only a small amount of input.

title: Improvements to weakspot.
body:
### Description
Improvements to weakspot.

Gets rid of `defaultScore` (which was hacky), instead makes the learning rate faster at the start so that it's a simple mean for the first `perCharCount` of each letter and an exponential average afterwards. Chars that haven't been seen at all don't contribute to a word's score.

The effect should be that it seems "fairer" with only a small amount of input.

title: Simplify replay seek click handler
body:
### Description
Makes use of jQuery.fn.on 2nd argument selector
(https://stackoverflow.com/a/1207393/6791873).

Apart from being a lot simpler and cross-platform, this also fixes replay
seeking breaking in some strange conditions like having the Firefox
devtools open. Yes, it took me a while to figure that one out.

This, combined with the input rewrite #1325, should fix all replay problems/errors I personally came across.

title: Add GitHub workflow to lint and auto-format PRs
body:
<!-- please read the comments -->

<!-- Adding a language or a theme? For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well. For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps! 

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot. 

 -->

### Description
Adds a workflow that on every PR **merge** to **any** branch, runs prettier (`pretty-quick`) to fix the new commits. This should finally fix the issues with formatting coming from PRs made through the GitHub UI or other means that skip the pre-commit hook.

After merging, you should run
```
npx prettier --write .
```
on all active branches to fix all leftover formatting issues.
After this, no more badly formatted code should ever reach master again, which means no more noise diff on unrelated commits :)

<!-- please check the items you have completed -->

title: Add weakspot mode.
body:
### Description
Keeps track of a per-character "weakness" score, basically a moving average of the spacing duration with a penalty for incorrect letters. The weakspot funbox mode uses this to bias towards words with lots of weak letters.

There are a few hardcoded parameters here that I tweaked a bit until it seemed right to me, but could use some work. LMK if there's a better place to put them.

I've only tested it with English; it should work with other scripts but might behave a little weirdly if there are a lot more characters. (It wouldn't break, it just might not make obviously sensible word choices.)

It doesn't persist weakness scores at the moment. Having used it for a bit I actually like it that way, it gives a feel of working on particular things for one session but being able to reset it.

title: Added min burst
body:
### Description
I have attempted to add min burst.

* Added toggle live burst speed from command line and settings page
* Added fail if burst speed is lower than custom speed, can set in command line and settings page
* Burst speed is in stats page after the test, but does not have any value

The calculateBurst() method in test-stats.js just needs to be modified to return the burst speed and everything should work. A method proposed by Miodec in Discord:
Track the timestamp the word was started and finished
Then calculate the wpm based on how many letters in that word + space

Hopefully someone can use this PR to finish this feature?

title: 82 new French quotes
body:
<!-- please read the comments -->

<!-- Adding a language or a theme? For languages, make sure to edit the `_list.json`, `_groups.json` files, and add the `language.json` file as well. For themes, make sure to add the `theme.css` file. It will not work if you don't follow these steps! 

If your change is visual (mainly themes) it would be extra awesome if you could include a screenshot. 

 -->

### Description
Addition of eighty two new quotes for French with sources and length. The quotes are taken from a random selection of wikiquote articles.
<details>
<summary>Names of the random articles</summary>

- François Schuiten
- Gloria
- Alan Kay
- Vertu
- Évolution
- René Branquart
- François-Xavier Bellamy
- Maxime Rovère
- ZAD
- Camille Saint-Saëns
- Roschdy Zem
- Roy Lewis
- Portal
- Roger Lambelin
- Brian Aldiss
- Névrose
- Mordecai Roshwald
- La Porte des anges
- Divorce
- Jacques Ellul
- Michaël Buffat
- Robert Dautray
- Dictionnaire égoïste de la littérature française
- Mode
- Alan Moore
- Les Vitelloni
- Boubou Hama
- Félix Houphouët-Boigny
- Vol de nuit
- Publius Syrus
- Manning Johnson
- Lecteur
- Malcolm Muggeridge
- Jean Mermoz
- Les Maîtres sonneurs
- Philippe Leclerc de Hauteclocque
- Animisme
- Cerveau
- Gérard Leclerc (essayiste)

</details>

The fancy typographical symbols such guillemots («), smart apostrophes (’), non-breaking spaces ( ), ligatures (œ), etc.were replaced by an equivalent that's easier to type. However, I let the fancy typographic symbols stay in the source because the user doesn't have to type it.

Distribution in respect to length:
| Short | Medium | Long | Thicc |
|---------|------------|--------|---------|
|30| 26| 17| 9|

I reviewed all the quotes manually to correct some formatting errors here and there as well as removing inappropriate quotes that my script picked up while querying the wikiquote API.

title: Add poetry mode to funbox
body:
### Description
<!-- Please describe the change(s) made in your PR -->
I added a funbox option to load poems as test text instead of random words.

Lifecycle:
If config.funbox is "poetry", disable other text generation (from random lists) and ask api for a new poem.
Send a request to: https://poetrydb.org/random for the new poem.
Do some cleaning of the poem text (remove unwanted chars and spaces...etc)
Return scrubbed text to the awaiting call.

title: Add Security Policy
body: ### Description This pull request adds a security policy to MonkeyType in order to better facilitate responsible vulnerability disclosures, moving them out of GitHub issues and into email/discord. Included in the policy is a `/security-policy.html` page with footer link, as well as a security policy in `/.well-known/security.txt`. Security.txt is an [Internet Draft](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-foudil-securitytxt-12) that has been submitted for RFC review, it's stated mission: > “When security risks in web services are discovered by independent security researchers who understand the severity of the risk, they often lack the channels to disclose them properly. As a result, security issues may be left unreported. security.txt defines a standard to help organizations define the process for security researchers to disclose security vulnerabilities securely.” *Key Changes* - Added `/static/security-policy.html`, which is essentially a copy of `privacy-policy.html` with security policy language - Added `/static/.well-known/security.txt` which includes a template created with [securitytxt.org](https://securitytxt.org/) - Added the `dot:true` argument to gulpfile in order to copy `./well-known/*` to dist - Added fontawesome icon to footer, linking to `security-policy.html` ### `/security-policy` ### `/.well-known/security.txt` ### `/` > Changes in footer . ### Checklist - [x] I have read the [`CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md`](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) and the [`CONTRIBUTING.md`](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x] I checked if my PR has any bugs or other issues that could reduce the stability of the project - [x] I understand that the maintainer has the right to reject my contribution and it may not get accepted. Resolves feature request in discussion [#1485](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/discussions/1485). Related to #1476 #1498 #1503 #1348

title: Feature/min acc grace
body:
### Checklist
- [x] I have read the [`CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md`](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) and the [`CONTRIBUTING.md`](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [x] If my PR is a new language or theme I modified the appropriate files to incorporate the language or theme
- [x] I checked if my PR has any bugs or other issues that could reduce the stability of the project
- [x] I understand that the maintainer has the right to reject my PR and it may not get accepted.

### Note

This is actually a feature request, I apologize if making a PR for this is inappropriate, and if so I'll be glad to create a discussion first.

### What and why

So I'm not great at typing, but I'd like to get better, which is why I started using monkeytype. But I wanted to make sure I didn't pick up any bad habits, so I want my min accuracy set to 95%. The issue with that is that if I make a mistake at the start I'm immediately dead. This feature tries to mitigate that by reducing the impact of errors at the start of each test.

### How

This PR as well as adding the setting and its corresponding frontend and command line entry, modifies the way the players accuracy is calculated in `test-timer.js` by conditionally calling a new function in `test-stats.js` if the setting is on.
https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/blob/15bbef6260b0eae49949379fbffaf7ec2d6402e6/src/js/test/test-timer.js#L41
This new function will multiply `accuracy.incorrect` with a fraction based on the `minAccCustom` config value and the total keystroke count before completing the accuracy calculation as usual.  
The new funktion:
```js
export function calculateAccuracyWithGrace() {
  const graceCharacters = Config.minAccCustom / 2.5;
  const grace =
    Math.min(accuracy.correct + accuracy.incorrect, graceCharacters) /
    graceCharacters;
  const incorrect = accuracy.incorrect * grace;
  return (accuracy.correct / (accuracy.correct + incorrect)) * 100;
}
```
The precise calculation feels ok to me at this point, its not helping to much, just enough, but this is just my thoughts, so I'd be happy to hear your thoughts too.

### Testing

I have been using this a good bit locally to tweak the function, and everything seems to work as intended. However I've not written any tests or similar for the function. I did however do my best to keep to the same style and structure as the project.

title: Mongo
body:
This is the almost complete mongo version of the project. Known errors and things that still need to be done can be found in the `backend/mongo-todo.md file`. I'm sharing this so that others can try out, test, and develop with this version.

Limited summary of what I did:
Firebase cloud functions were moved to api routes inside of an express.js server. Server interacts with the local Mongo database through mongoose. Mongoose models are in the `backend/models` folder with subschemas inside the subschemas folder. Server interacts with the frontend through `/api/` routes. Everything that could be copy/pasted from the old code was, so that new bugs could be avoided. User specific api routes require the user to provide a jwt. This jwt is automatically passed via `axiosInstance`, which also refreshes the token when it expires. Where user data used to be retrieved with `firebase.auth().currentUser`, it is now retrieved with `DB.currentUser()`, which fetches user data from localstorage. 

I'm going to keep working on this and will give an update if I think that it's completely ready. In the mean time, feel free to ask me anything.

title: fixed keymap not highlighting in simon says
body:
Fixes #1435 

As mentioned in the issue...

$(".active-key").removeClass("active-key"); in config.js is being called after active key is set in keymap.js so when the test starts there is no key highlighted.

After looking in the call stacks for these functions I am still unsure why this is happening but manually calling       TestUI.showWords(); in funbox.js to call the highlighting function seems to fix everything as we are essentially calling the highlighting function in keymap.js AFTER its been set via funbox.js

title: Ignoring Zen Trailing AFK #966
body:
This commit addresses the improvement suggested in #966. 

This code works by storing the last time an alpha key or the spacebar was pressed. I decided not to count pressing backspaces or caps locks as 'typing' but this can be changed by adding `TestStats.updateLastKeypress()` to the handling functions in `input-controller.js`. It uses this to create a new, shorter test time which is then used to cut the critical arrays which are used to calculate stats.

title: Fixed undefined (NaN) issue with Personal Average Pace Caret when using quote mode
body:
Change pace caret for quotes to use average wpm of up to a max of the last 10 quotes completed in target mode if the current quote has never been completed before rather than returning (0 / 0) resulting in undefined (NaN), and displaying an invalid pace caret position in the block in certain situations.

This issue is not listed, but was discovered by me not long ago today.

Reproducing the issue:
1. Set the pace caret mode to "average" in settings.
2. Load up a test in quote mode (any sub-mode is fine).
3. Reload until you find a quote that you have completed before (displaying the average wpm of that quote).
3. Complete the test beating the pace caret so it doesn't disappear before navigating to the results.
4. Start another test, and if the new test quote is a quote you have not completed before, you will notice the pace caret position is in a bugged position in the block due to not being hidden from the previous test, and in the console you will see a log output of "avg pace NaN".

title: Use localStorage instead of cookies
body:
Cookies are not recommended for storing large amount of data when it's not used by the server. [Here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/19869560)'s an explanation on StackOverflow.

The MDN docs [recommend](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Storage_API/Using_the_Web_Storage_API#basic_concepts) using the API (`setItem()`, `getItem()`, `deleteItem()`) over accessing values in the `localStorage` object directly, so that's what I did.

I also renamed every relevant function and variable related to cookies.

Note that after migrating I'm clearing the cookies with the JQuery cookie plugin. I'm not sure why wasn't used in other parts in the code. Let me know if you're planning on removing it so I can replace the cookie-clearing part with a vanilla JS implementation.

Remember to test locally if the cookies are correctly migrated before merging :S I don't want you to get spammed by people losing their configs because of something I missed hehe

title: Improve the Top 200 Filipino words
body:
@Miodec As per the discussion here:
https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/discussions/1103

@Killer8Hyper brought it to my attention, and he has valid points indeed. The Filipino words are tricky also since they have subtle variations. But, I think could be mainly grouped as formal and informal variants. Formal is more in the contexts of formal writing, and the informal more in the context of social chatting. And I agree that it's better to use the formal variants also so that Filipinos will not forget their original forms. Aside from that, we avoided:
- words with punctuation (e.g. `pag-ibig`)
- words with capitalization (e.g. `Diyos` or `Pinoy`)
- duplicated/similar words

Special thanks to @Killer8Hyper for helping with the improved list. This makes it conform better with other Top 200 Words list.

title: Add release and unstable deployment targets, to use with unstable/experimental channel
body:
So I did the research and this is how an unstable channel for non-release updates can be set up. I'd really like this to be implemented because I feel this way the actual releases would have more value and be more stable (more testing from community users, less bugs encountered by casual users). The changelog also becomes more consistent with previous versions

## Setup
1. Add a new site: Firebase console > Hosting > Advanced > Add another site
2. Set up a domain/subdomain for the site: `testing.monkeytype.com` and `unstable.monkeytype.com` are ones that I personally like. I don't think `beta` would be correct here, because it's use is more common for pre-release/ready-to-use versions. (Though you could add as many sites/targets as you like, and beta could be one of them!)
3. Set up `.firebaserc` according to `.firebaserc_example` or use `firebase use` (which I think does the same thing). I say this just in case you don't have it set up, since `package.json` has the `-P monkey-type` flag, which I removed in this PR to make it less "hardcoded"
4. Set up targets locally:
```shell
firebase target:apply hosting release <release-site-id>
firebase target:apply hosting unstable <unstable-site-id>
```
Notes:
* The deployment scripts for each channel is called `deploy:live:<channel>`. `deploy:live:functions` is still functions.
* The commands from step 4 edit `.firebaserc` and save the target to site-name linking there.

And that's about it! I'm pretty sure I didn't miss anything, All the steps are explained in more detail in the Firebase [docs](https://firebase.google.com/docs/hosting/multisites) if you want to check them out

Edit: Another good subdomain: `dev.`

title: Fix transition on page reload
body:
Fixes #863

https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/issues/863

When refreshing the page or going back using the browser back button on a route other than "/" you would see a flickering on the animation transition between the main page `pageTest` and the other one. This is caused because the `pageTest` is set to active by default in the html.

This PR aims to fix this behaviour by setting the `pageTest` to `hidden`  and setting the proper classes when the page is loaded.

title: Add finnish_1k and finnish_10k
body:
### Source

Source of the `finnish_1k` is [Wiktionary: Mikalaari/suomen tuhat yleisintä sanaa (1000 most common Finnish words)](https://fi.wiktionary.org/wiki/K%C3%A4ytt%C3%A4j%C3%A4:Mikalaari/suomen_tuhat_yleisint%C3%A4_sanaa)

The `finnish_10k` uses the `finnish_1k` as the base and patches the missing ~9000 with random words from [Every Finnish Word](https://github.com/hugovk/everyfinnishword).

### Filters

Filtered the words with `length >= 2 && length <= 15 && /^[a-zäöå]*$/` as Finnish words can in theory have infinite length. I still have the script so I can easily generate a new list if you are not happy with the filters.

### Licenses

The license of the Wiktionary list is [Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-SA 3.0)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/).

The licenses of the Every Finnish Word are [GNU LGPL (Lesser General Public License)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Lesser_General_Public_License), [EUPL v.1.1 (European Union Public Licence) ](https://spdx.org/licenses/EUPL-1.1.html) and [CC Attribution 3.0 Unported](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).

So I think we should credit the authors. I'm quite new to open source, so how should we do this?

body:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/pull/581, so please merge that one first. Despite looking rather long, this PR will be quite short once the preceding PR is merged.

- Made the ChartJS dependency managed by npm and bundled with our JS code.

This PR is part of the refactoring effort in #495 and #579

title: Adding Browserify to the build process
body:
- Split up the set of JS files into two groups: refactored files and global (legacy) files.

- Changed the build process to be the following:

    1. delete dist/
    1. lint the refactored JS files
    1. concatenate and lint the legacy JS files, and output to dist/gen/index.js
    1. copy the refactored files to dist/gen/
    1. bundle the JS files together using Browserify, with the generated index.js as the entry point
    1. copy html and static files to dist/
    1. compile and copy sass to dist/css

- Made db.js into an ES6 module. I chose to start with this file since it's already pretty small and self-contained. The global `dbSnapshot` was replaced with getter and setter functions. Eventually all of the JS files should be made into ES6 modules.

- Added global-dependencies.js, which imports all the dependencies that the legacy files use. These dependencies are both external (from npm) and internal (from refactored JS files).

- Added exports.js to expose any debug info you'd want to have in the browser console. In this PR, we're exporting a `snapshot()` function which exposes the `dbSnapshot`.

- Added Babelify to use ES6 syntax with Browserify. This adds more lines to the generated JS, which is not good, but it's possible to reduce the size eventually.

This PR is part of the refactoring effort in https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/issues/495

title: Add ESLint for static analysis of code
body:
*Contains commits from https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/pull/522, so we should merge that PR before this one.*

More improvements to the build process.

- `gulp-eslint` and `babel-eslint` are installed.
- Linting is applied to the concatenated JS source as part of the build pipeline.
- If there are lint errors, then the build will **fail** outright.
- Temporarily treats some serious errors as "warnings" just so that the app will build. The goal is to eliminate these warnings asap, and not to introduce new warnings or errors.
- I've fixed many of the errors, but [many still remain](https://pastebin.com/raw/t9M5qWWQ).
- The highest priority warning is `no-use-before-define`. Most of these are cyclic dependencies of globals between files - a.js depends on b.js depends on a.js - so they are tricky to resolve.
- After these warnings are taken care of (as much as possible - don't force it), migrating to Webpack should be much easier.
- A downside is that watching and building is slower, but for now that's the price to pay for better code health.

title: Adding a build process to MT development
body:
Lots of changes to MT's project structure and development workflow! If you don't contribute to MT, you can ignore this PR.

- To run MT you must now build the code. This can now be done with `npm run build`. However, it's even better to use `npm run start:dev`, which will launch a dev server that automatically builds whenever the code is changed.
- The build generates the entire `dist/` directory.
- Monkeytype JS and sass files have been moved to `src/`.
- Firebase now hosts `dist/` instead of `public/`.
- The build performs four simple steps:
    1. clean - removes the `dist/` directory
    1. static - copies all files from `public` to `dist/`
    1. sass - builds sass in `src/sass/` and outputs to `dist/css/style.css`
    1. cat - concatenates all code in `src/js/` and outputs to `dist/js/monkeytype.js`
- Each step can be run independently with `npx gulp <stepname>`, or you can run them all with `npx gulp rebuild`. You can also use `npx gulp build` to run only the last three steps.
- This means, besides dependencies, there is now a single `monkeytype.js` file for clients to download. I haven't tested the performance gain, but there *probably* is some performance gain. It's currently unminified to allow for in-browser debugging.
- The build is made using [Gulp](https://gulpjs.com/) as a stepping stone towards [Webpack](https://webpack.js.org/) (not in this PR). I would like to switch to Webpack in the near future, but that proved to be too much for one PR. In any case, these two build tools can coexist during the transition.
- Updated CONTRIBUTING.md.
- Many dev dependencies added for building.

@Miodec , you might have to make some deployment changes to run the build, like adding an `npm run deploy` script for instance.

As I tested it, the fix worked for the problem, but if it somehow conflicts with the scoreboard, I'm ok to it not being accepted.

title: Fix incorrect bottom row offset of onscreen layout
body:
So, as a result of my [previous PR](https://github.com/Miodec/monkeytype/pull/490), the ISO key now works, but this had a knock-on effect of offsetting the visual representation of the keyboard.

This PR is a quick fix for that issue.

What I have done is move the ISO key to the last entry in the list of keys, so that it doesn't insert itself into an unexpected place. This keeps support for the key, but doesn't mess up the graphic, as the keys in the layout file are in the same order as before.

This means the ISO key will not be appear in the layout graphic - only the ANSI keys will appear - but the ISO key will still register when typed.

Ideally, a better solution would be to add the new key to the graphic (i.e. add the extra key at the start of row4 in the html, and adjust the offset accordingly). However, this approach requires recompiling the scss, which I'm not familiar with. Hence this simpler solution instead.

title: Remove private methods from simplePopup (fixes in Firefox, Safari, Internet Explorer)
body:
This fixes #503.

The added simplePopup had private methods, which totally breaks Firefox and Safari since it's a syntax error and this file then doesn't load at all. We can simply make these methods public, there's no reason they need to be private to work, it's just a code organization thing.

title: Improve support for international (ISO) keyboards
body:
The purpose of this patch is to allow support for the "ISO key" - that's they key between left shift and Z on an ISO keyboard. ISO keyboards are the default in European countries but in the current version of the app, this key cannot be mapped to anything. 

A side effect of this fix is that the key lookup system is simplified. 

Detailed explanation follows:

The existing code essentially does a two-step process to lookup a key:
1. keyboard event code  -->  qwerty mapping
2. qwerty mapping --> selected layout mapping.

A consequence of this approach is that keys cannot be mapped unless they exist in the default ANSI qwerty set. For example, the key event for the extra ISO key mentioned above is "IntlBackslash", but it's not possible to add this as there is already a mapping to Backslash.

To avoid this problem, this patch simplifies the key lookup to a single step process:
keyboard event code -->  selected layout mapping

The existing Qwerty defaults ("qwertyMasterLayout") are replaced by a simple array, keyEventCodes, which defines the list of keys that should be in the layout mapping. Notice I have added IntlBackslash just before Z. Consequently, I have also added a mapping for this key (usually the backslash character) to each of the layout mappings. On ANSI boards, this key doesn't exist, so the event won't be called. As an aside, on the Azerty keyboard, this extra key is actually "<>", so a side effect of this change is that Azerty support is improved too.

Now, coming on to my motivation for this patch in the first place, I wanted to fix the [Colemak-DH ](http://colemakmods.github.io/mod-dh/gfx/colemak_dh_keyb_iso.png)and [Colemak-DHk](http://colemakmods.github.io/mod-dh/gfx/colemak_dhk_keyb_iso.png) layouts, as they should use the [angle mod](https://colemakmods.github.io/ergonomic-mods/angle.html), and on ISO keyboards, the extra ISO key should be mapped to Z, So I have fixed those too. For ANSI users, there should be no effect as the IntlBackslash event won't be triggered, and in the Colemak-DH layout files, Z is still mapped to the Qwerty B key as before, so ANSI users should not see any change.

title: Added package.json. Made some workflow changes and added some dependencies from npm.
body:
- Dev dependencies added: **husky**, **prettier**, **prettier-quick** (via instructions from https://prettier.io/docs/en/install.html and https://prettier.io/docs/en/precommit.html#option-2-pretty-quickhttpsgithubcomazzpretty-quick)
- Workflow changes:
  - Install dependencies with `npm install`. It automatically runs `npm install` in the `functions/` directory as well.
  - Run with `npm start` - it just runs `firebase serve` under the hood.
  - Prettier is now run as a pre-commit hook via husky. This means that whenever you `git commit`, prettier will prettify your staged files (**as long as you've installed husky using `npm install`**, otherwise you will bypass prettification).
- The updated workflow is reflected in CONTRIBUTING.md.

Only the first four files in the diff are significant. The rest are just formatting changes. See the commit history to make better sense of it.

title: Feature: option to use single list command line
body:
Current command line is good, but there are also use cases where a single list is very useful. (e.g. when searching for a command that doesn't get exposed because it is burried in a submenu.) This proposed feature will not hinder existing workflow(i hope) as it is triggered manually by default in the command line by typing **>** and then your search term.

Sample commands:

- Switching to 8008 theme, type **>8008**
- Changing to Nunito font, type **>Nunito**
- Changing to words mode, type **>words**
- Changing custom word count, type **>custom word**

You get the idea. It's basically a consolidation of commands that can be enabled or triggered.

Early version demo here: https://discordapp.com/channels/713194177403420752/713196019206324306/764527921670389821

Thinking of die hard typers typing at least 3600 seconds means 3600 more depth in the call stack (I'm aware the current code has already been proven even with 24hour sessions! :D Still good to have a bit more stability/efficiency in memory). title: Feature: Indicate Typos
body:
This feature is somewhat the answer for users that wanted immediate feedback to see what they have typed wrong from probably the ff reasons:

- They're keyboard switches exhibits bouncing but they aren't aware yet
- Reading too fast they'll see that they were typing words ahead instead of the current word
- Wanted to be conscious of their mistakes immediately instead of waiting till the end of the session (and likely to make better approaches the next time they encountered the words)
- Helping to realise their stupidity :) <-- me

There might be other reasons, but ultimately I think a number of MT users will appreciate a similar functionality

title: Adds caps lock backspace mode and fixes some caps lock bugs.
body:
Features added:

1. Treats caps lock as backspace if this new setting is on. Caps lock is now emulated on both default and emulated layouts.

2. Adds the capability to "unshift" from upper to lower case with caps lock on. Both default and emulated layouts should now behave as expected for all caps lock-related typing.

Simultaneous bug fixes:

1. Fixes a bug where shifting between upper and lower case would sometimes be wrong while caps lock is on. For example, with caps lock turned on in emulated Colemak, the O key would type lowercase o because it corresponds to a symbol and not a letter in Qwerty.

2. Fixes a bug where pressing the enter key in an emulated layout would result in a console error.

title: Remove special ’ from French text, use ' instead.
body:
’ is not available on French Azerty keyboard, so it's impossible to type it.
It's technically the correct character in "jusqu'au", but you need an auto correct to fix that for you.
Since their is no autocorrect in monkey type, I suggest replacing the ’ by a simple ' available on all keyboards.

If you are wondering how come that French people can't type French with French keyboard, there are actually people pushing for an updated Azerty layout: https://www.lemonde.fr/pixels/article/2016/04/23/bepo-dvorak-colemak-a-la-recherche-du-clavier-francais-qui-pourrait-remplacer-l-azerty_4907632_4408996.html

  * Outline Block
  * Underline
* Adds settings selection of caret
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32944224/83224652-cabc5b80-a132-11ea-8005-ddd365fc526c.png)
* Adds command line support for caret selection
![gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32944224/83225341-67cbc400-a134-11ea-911e-bf9b1cfcfdb4.gif)
* Saved as all other preferences are
* Works with all font sizes
* Changed caret animation from color -> opacity to support all caret types
* Changed caret scaling to transform via scale instead of em to support all caret types
* Changed settings buttons to auto columns versus template to scale evenly with any number of buttons

closes https://github.com/Miodec/monkey-type/issues/90 - Add cursor selection feature request

title: Scroll Longform text
body:
The window will scroll after the cursors passes text that is beyond the middle of the page, keeping the active text in the middle of the window.

title: Prevent text input from escape key in Safari
body: Currently, in Safari, whenever you hit the escape key while the text field is focused/focusable, the text `Escape` is appended to the text cursor in the text field.
